text: as the days on which the Jews got relief from their enemies, and as the month that had been turned for them from sorrow into gladness and from mourning into a holiday; that they should make them days of feasting and gladness, days for sending gifts of food to one another and gifts to the poor.
verse_text: Esther 9.22 Because on those days the Jews revenged themselves of their enemies, and their mourning and sorrow were turned into mirth and joy, and that these should be days of feasting and gladness, in which they should send one to another portions of meats; and should give gifts to the poor.

text: Esther 9.22 as the days on which the Jews got relief from their enemies, and as the month that had been turned for them from sorrow into gladness and from mourning into a holiday; that they should make them days of feasting and gladness, days for sending gifts of food to one another and gifts to the poor.
verse_text: Esther 9.22 quia in ipsis diebus se ulti sunt Judæi de inimicis suis, et luctus atque tristitia in hilaritatem gaudiumque conversa sunt, essentque dies isti epularum atque lætitiæ, et mitterent sibi invicem ciborum partes, et pauperibus munuscula largirentur.

text: Esther 9.22 as the days on which the Jews got relief from their enemies, and as the month that had been turned for them from sorrow into gladness and from mourning into a holiday; that they should make them days of feasting and gladness, days for sending gifts of food to one another and gifts to the poor.
verse_text: Esther 9.22 According to the dayes wherein the Iewes rested from their enemies, and the moneth which was turned vnto them from sorowe to ioy, and from mourning into a ioyfull day, to keepe them the dayes of feasting, and ioy, and to sende presents euery man to his neyghbour, and giftes to the poore.

text: Esther 9.22 as the days on which the Jews got relief from their enemies, and as the month that had been turned for them from sorrow into gladness and from mourning into a holiday; that they should make them days of feasting and gladness, days for sending gifts of food to one another and gifts to the poor.
verse_text: Esther 9.22 As the dayes wherein the Iewes rested from their enemies, & the moneth which was turned vnto them, from sorrow to ioy, and from mourning into a good day: that they should make them daies of feasting and ioy, and of sending portions one to another, and gifts to the poore.

text: the Jews firmly obligated themselves and their offspring and all who joined them, that without fail they would keep these two days according to what was written and at the time appointed every year,
verse_text: Esther 9.27 And the things that they suffered, and that were afterwards changed, the Jews took upon themselves and their seed, and upon all that had a mind to be joined to their religion, so that it should be lawful for none to pass these days without solemnity: which the writing testifieth, and certain times require, as the years continually succeed one another.

text: Esther 9.27 the Jews firmly obligated themselves and their offspring and all who joined them, that without fail they would keep these two days according to what was written and at the time appointed every year,
verse_text: Esther 9.27 quæque sustinuerunt, et quæ deinceps immutata sunt, susceperunt Judæi super se et semen suum, et super cunctos qui religioni eorum voluerunt copulari, ut nulli liceat duos hos dies absque solemnitate transigere, quos scriptura testatur, et certa expetunt tempora, annis sibi jugiter succedentibus.

text: Esther 9.27 the Jews firmly obligated themselves and their offspring and all who joined them, that without fail they would keep these two days according to what was written and at the time appointed every year,

text: Esther 9.27 the Jews firmly obligated themselves and their offspring and all who joined them, that without fail they would keep these two days according to what was written and at the time appointed every year,

text: that these days should be remembered and kept throughout every generation, in every clan, province, and city, and that these days of Purim should never fall into disuse among the Jews, nor should the commemoration of these days cease among their descendants.
verse_text: Esther 9.28 These are the days which shall never be forgot: and which all provinces in the whole world shall celebrate throughout all generations: neither is there any city wherein the days of Phurim, that is, of lots, must not be observed by the Jews, and by their posterity, which is bound to these ceremonies.

text: Esther 9.28 that these days should be remembered and kept throughout every generation, in every clan, province, and city, and that these days of Purim should never fall into disuse among the Jews, nor should the commemoration of these days cease among their descendants.
verse_text: Esther 9.28 Isti sunt dies, quos nulla umquam delebit oblivio, et per singulas generationes cunctæ in toto orbe provinciæ celebrabunt: nec est ulla civitas, in qua dies phurim, id est sortium, non observentur a Judæis, et ab eorum progenie, quæ his cæremoniis obligata est.

text: Esther 9.28 that these days should be remembered and kept throughout every generation, in every clan, province, and city, and that these days of Purim should never fall into disuse among the Jews, nor should the commemoration of these days cease among their descendants.
verse_text: Esther 9.28 And that these dayes shoulde be remembred, and kept throughout euery generation and euery familie, and euery prouince, and euery citie: euen these daies of Purim should not faile among the Iewes, and the memoriall of them should not perish from their seede.

text: Esther 9.28 that these days should be remembered and kept throughout every generation, in every clan, province, and city, and that these days of Purim should never fall into disuse among the Jews, nor should the commemoration of these days cease among their descendants.

text: They have all turned aside; together they have become corrupt; there is none who does good, not even one.

Venenum aspidum sub labiis eorum, quorum os maledictione et amaritudine plenum est; veloces pedes eorum ad effundendum sanguinem. Contritio et infelicitas in viis eorum, et viam pacis non cognoverunt; non est timor Dei ante oculos eorum.

text: Psalms 16.11 You make known to me the path of life; in your presence there is fullness of joy; at your right hand are pleasures forevermore.
verse_text: Psalms 16.11 Thou wilt shew me the path of life: in thy presence is the fulnesse of ioy: and at thy right hand there are pleasures for euermore.

text: Psalms 16.11 You make known to me the path of life; in your presence there is fullness of joy; at your right hand are pleasures forevermore.
verse_text: Psalms 16.11 Thou wilt shewe me the path of life: in thy presence is fulnesse of ioy, at thy right hand there are pleasures for euermore.

text: From your presence let my vindication come! Let your eyes behold the right!

text: Psalms 17.2 From your presence let my vindication come! Let your eyes behold the right!

text: Psalms 17.2 From your presence let my vindication come! Let your eyes behold the right!

text: Psalms 17.2 From your presence let my vindication come! Let your eyes behold the right!
verse_text: Psalms 17.2 Let my sentence come forth from thy presence: let thine eyes beholde the things that are equall.

text: You have tried my heart, you have visited me by night, you have tested me, and you will find nothing; I have purposed that my mouth will not transgress.

text: Psalms 17.3 You have tried my heart, you have visited me by night, you have tested me, and you will find nothing; I have purposed that my mouth will not transgress.
verse_text: Psalms 16.3 Thou hast proued my hart, and visited it by night: by fire thou hast examined me, and there is no iniquitie found in me.

text: Psalms 17.3 You have tried my heart, you have visited me by night, you have tested me, and you will find nothing; I have purposed that my mouth will not transgress.
verse_text: Psalms 17.3 Thou hast prooued and visited mine heart in the night: thou hast tryed me, and foundest nothing: for I was purposed that my mouth should not offend.

text: Psalms 17.3 You have tried my heart, you have visited me by night, you have tested me, and you will find nothing; I have purposed that my mouth will not transgress.
verse_text: Psalms 17.3 Thou hast prooued mine heart, thou hast visited me in the night, thou hast tried me, and shalt find nothing: I am purposed that my mouth shall not transgresse.

text: As for me, I shall behold your face in righteousness; when I awake, I shall be satisfied with your likeness.
verse_text: Psalms 16.15 Ego autem in justitia apparebo conspectui tuo; satiabor cum apparuerit gloria tua.

text: Psalms 17.15 As for me, I shall behold your face in righteousness; when I awake, I shall be satisfied with your likeness.

text: Psalms 17.15 As for me, I shall behold your face in righteousness; when I awake, I shall be satisfied with your likeness.
verse_text: Psalms 17.15 As for me, I will behold thy face in righteousnesse: I shall bee satisfied, when I awake, with thy likenesse.

text: The cords of death encompassed me; the torrents of destruction assailed me;

text: Psalms 18.4 The cords of death encompassed me; the torrents of destruction assailed me;

text: Psalms 18.4 The cords of death encompassed me; the torrents of destruction assailed me;

text: Psalms 18.4 The cords of death encompassed me; the torrents of destruction assailed me;

text: In my distress I called upon the LORD; to my God I cried for help. From his temple he heard my voice, and my cry to him reached his ears.
verse_text: Psalms 17.7 In tribulatione mea invocavi Dominum, et ad Deum meum clamavi: et exaudivit de templo sancto suo vocem meam; et clamor meus in conspectu ejus introivit in aures ejus.
label: True

text: Psalms 18.6 In my distress I called upon the LORD; to my God I cried for help. From his temple he heard my voice, and my cry to him reached his ears.
verse_text: Psalms 17.7 In my tribulation I haue inuocated our Lord, and haue cried to my God: And he hath heard my voice from his holie temple: and my crie in his sight, hath entered into his eares.
label: True

text: Psalms 18.6 In my distress I called upon the LORD; to my God I cried for help. From his temple he heard my voice, and my cry to him reached his ears.
verse_text: Psalms 18.6 But in my trouble did I call vpon the Lord, and cryed vnto my God: he heard my voyce out of his Temple, and my crye did come before him, euen into his eares.

text: Psalms 18.6 In my distress I called upon the LORD; to my God I cried for help. From his temple he heard my voice, and my cry to him reached his ears.
verse_text: Psalms 18.6 In my distresse I called vpon the Lord, and cryed vnto my God: hee heard my voyce out of his temple, and my crie came before him, euen into his eares.

text: Then the earth reeled and rocked; the foundations also of the mountains trembled and quaked, because he was angry.

text: For by you I can run against a troop, and by my God I can leap over a wall.

text: This God- his way is perfect; the word of the LORD proves true; he is a shield for all those who take refuge in him.

text: TO THE CHOIRMASTER: ACCORDING TO THE DOE OF THE DAWN. A PSALM OF DAVID. My God, my God, why have you forsaken me? Why are you so far from saving me, from the words of my groaning?
verse_text: Psalms 21.2 Deus, Deus meus, respice in me: quare me dereliquisti? longe a salute mea verba delictorum meorum.
label: True

text: Psalms 22.1 TO THE CHOIRMASTER: ACCORDING TO THE DOE OF THE DAWN. A PSALM OF DAVID. My God, my God, why have you forsaken me? Why are you so far from saving me, from the words of my groaning?
verse_text: Psalms 22.1 To him that excelleth upon Aiieleth Hasshahar. A Psalme of Dauid. My God, my God, why hast thou forsaken me, and art so farre from mine health, and from the wordes of my roaring?

text: Psalms 22.1 TO THE CHOIRMASTER: ACCORDING TO THE DOE OF THE DAWN. A PSALM OF DAVID. My God, my God, why have you forsaken me? Why are you so far from saving me, from the words of my groaning?
verse_text: Psalms 22.1 My God, my God, why hast thou forsaken mee? Why art thou so far from helping me, and from the words of my roaring?

text: O my God, I cry by day, but you do not answer, and by night, but I find no rest.
verse_text: Psalms 21.3 Deus meus, clamabo per diem, et non exaudies; et nocte, et non ad insipientiam mihi.
label: True

text: Psalms 22.2 O my God, I cry by day, but you do not answer, and by night, but I find no rest.
verse_text: Psalms 21.3 My God, I shal crie by day, and thou wilt not heare: and by night, and not for follie vnto me.
label: True

text: Psalms 22.2 O my God, I cry by day, but you do not answer, and by night, but I find no rest.
verse_text: Psalms 22.2 O my God, I crie by day, but thou hearest not, and by night, but haue no audience.

text: Psalms 22.2 O my God, I cry by day, but you do not answer, and by night, but I find no rest.
verse_text: Psalms 22.2 O my God, I crie in the day time, but thou hearest not; and in the night season, and am not silent.

text: Yet you are holy, enthroned on the praises of Israel.

verse_text: Psalms 22.3 But thou art holy, O thou that inhabitest the praises of Israel!

text: To you they cried and were rescued; in you they trusted and were not put to shame.

text: Psalms 22.5 To you they cried and were rescued; in you they trusted and were not put to shame.

text: Psalms 22.5 To you they cried and were rescued; in you they trusted and were not put to shame.

text: Yet you are he who took me from the womb; you made me trust you at my mother's breasts.

verse_text: Psalms 22.9 But thou art hee that tooke mee out of the wombe; thou didst make me hope, when I was vpon my mothers breasts.

text: Deliver my soul from the sword, my precious life from the power of the dog!

label: True

text: For he has not despised or abhorred the affliction of the afflicted, and he has not hidden his face from him, but has heard, when he cried to him.
verse_text: Psalms 21.25 Timeat eum omne semen Israël, quoniam non sprevit, neque despexit deprecationem pauperis, nec avertit faciem suam a me: et cum clamarem ad eum, exaudivit me.
label: True

text: Psalms 22.24 For he has not despised or abhorred the affliction of the afflicted, and he has not hidden his face from him, but has heard, when he cried to him.
verse_text: Psalms 21.25 Let al the seede of Israel feare him: because he hath not contemned, nor despised the petition of the poore. Neither hath he turned away his face from me: and when I cried to him he heard me.
label: True

text: Psalms 22.24 For he has not despised or abhorred the affliction of the afflicted, and he has not hidden his face from him, but has heard, when he cried to him.

text: A PSALM OF DAVID. The earth is the LORD's and the fullness thereof, the world and those who dwell therein,
verse_text: Psalms 23.1 Prima sabbati. Psalmus David. Domini est terra, et plenitudo ejus; orbis terrarum, et universi qui habitant in eo.

text: Psalms 24.1 A PSALM OF DAVID. The earth is the LORD's and the fullness thereof, the world and those who dwell therein,
verse_text: Psalms 23.1 The first of the Sabbath, the Psalme of Dauid. THE earth is our Lordes, and the fulnesse therof: the round world, and al that dwel therein.

text: Psalms 24.1 A PSALM OF DAVID. The earth is the LORD's and the fullness thereof, the world and those who dwell therein,
verse_text: Psalms 24.1 A Psalme of David. The earth is the Lordes, and all that therein is: the worlde and they that dwell therein.

text: Psalms 24.1 A PSALM OF DAVID. The earth is the LORD's and the fullness thereof, the world and those who dwell therein,
verse_text: Psalms 24.1 The earth is the Lords, and the fulnesse thereof; the world, and they that dwell therein.

text: Who shall ascend the hill of the LORD? And who shall stand in his holy place?

text: Psalms 24.3 Who shall ascend the hill of the LORD? And who shall stand in his holy place?

text: Psalms 24.3 Who shall ascend the hill of the LORD? And who shall stand in his holy place?

text: Psalms 24.3 Who shall ascend the hill of the LORD? And who shall stand in his holy place?
verse_text: Psalms 24.3 Who shall ascend into the hill of the Lord? and who shall stand in his holy place?

text: He who has clean hands and a pure heart, who does not lift up his soul to what is false and does not swear deceitfully.

text: Psalms 24.4 He who has clean hands and a pure heart, who does not lift up his soul to what is false and does not swear deceitfully.
verse_text: Psalms 23.4 The innocent of handes, and of cleane hart, that hath not taken his soule in vayne, nor sworne to his neighbour in guile.

text: Psalms 24.4 He who has clean hands and a pure heart, who does not lift up his soul to what is false and does not swear deceitfully.
verse_text: Psalms 24.4 Euen he that hath innocent handes, and a pure heart: which hath not lift vp his minde vnto vanitie, nor sworne deceitfully.

text: Psalms 24.4 He who has clean hands and a pure heart, who does not lift up his soul to what is false and does not swear deceitfully.
verse_text: Psalms 24.4 He that hath cleane hands, and a pure heart; who hath not lift vp his soule vnto vanitie, nor sworne deceitfully.

verse_text: Psalms 24.10 Who is this king of glory? the Lord of hostes, he is the king of glory. Selah.

text: O my God, in you I trust; let me not be put to shame; let not my enemies exult over me.
verse_text: Psalms 24.2 Deus meus, in te confido; non erubescam.

text: Psalms 25.2 O my God, in you I trust; let me not be put to shame; let not my enemies exult over me.

text: Psalms 25.2 O my God, in you I trust; let me not be put to shame; let not my enemies exult over me.
verse_text: Psalms 25.2 My God, I trust in thee: let me not be confounded: let not mine enemies reioyce ouer mee.

text: Psalms 25.2 O my God, in you I trust; let me not be put to shame; let not my enemies exult over me.
verse_text: Psalms 25.2 O my God, I trust in thee, let me not be ashamed: let not mine enemies triumph ouer me.

text: Indeed, none who wait for you shall be put to shame; they shall be ashamed who are wantonly treacherous.

text: Psalms 25.3 Indeed, none who wait for you shall be put to shame; they shall be ashamed who are wantonly treacherous.
verse_text: Psalms 25.3 So all that hope in thee, shall not be ashamed: but let them be confounded, that transgresse without cause.

text: Psalms 25.3 Indeed, none who wait for you shall be put to shame; they shall be ashamed who are wantonly treacherous.
verse_text: Psalms 25.3 Yea let none that waite on thee, be ashamed: let them bee ashamed which transgresse without cause.

text: Make me to know your ways, O LORD; teach me your paths.

text: Psalms 25.4 Make me to know your ways, O LORD; teach me your paths.

text: Psalms 25.4 Make me to know your ways, O LORD; teach me your paths.
verse_text: Psalms 25.4 Shewe mee thy wayes, O Lord: teach me thy pathes.

text: Good and upright is the LORD; therefore he instructs sinners in the way.

text: Psalms 25.8 Good and upright is the LORD; therefore he instructs sinners in the way.

verse_text: Psalms 25.9 The meeke will he guide in iudgement: and the meeke will he teach his way.

text: All the paths of the LORD are steadfast love and faithfulness, for those who keep his covenant and his testimonies.

text: Psalms 25.10 All the paths of the LORD are steadfast love and faithfulness, for those who keep his covenant and his testimonies.
verse_text: Psalms 24.10 Al the wayes of our Lord, be mercie and truth, to them that seeke after his testament and his testimonies.

text: Psalms 25.10 All the paths of the LORD are steadfast love and faithfulness, for those who keep his covenant and his testimonies.
verse_text: Psalms 25.10 All the pathes of the Lord are mercie and trueth vnto such as keepe his couenant and his testimonies.

verse_text: Psalms 25.10 All the pathes of the Lord are mercy and truth: vnto such as keepe his couenant, and his testimonies.

text: For your name's sake, O LORD, pardon my guilt, for it is great.

text: Oh, guard my soul, and deliver me! Let me not be put to shame, for I take refuge in you.

text: Psalms 25.20 Oh, guard my soul, and deliver me! Let me not be put to shame, for I take refuge in you.

text: Psalms 25.20 Oh, guard my soul, and deliver me! Let me not be put to shame, for I take refuge in you.
verse_text: Psalms 25.20 Keepe my soule, and deliuer me: let me not be confounded, for I trust in thee.

text: Psalms 25.20 Oh, guard my soul, and deliver me! Let me not be put to shame, for I take refuge in you.

text: May integrity and uprightness preserve me, for I wait for you.

text: Psalms 25.21 May integrity and uprightness preserve me, for I wait for you.
verse_text: Psalms 25.21 Let integritie and vprightnesse preserue me: for I wait on thee.

text: OF DAVID. Vindicate me, O LORD, for I have walked in my integrity, and I have trusted in the LORD without wavering.
verse_text: Psalms 25.1 In finem. Psalmus David. Judica me, Domine, quoniam ego in innocentia mea ingressus sum, et in Domino sperans non infirmabor.

text: Psalms 26.1 OF DAVID. Vindicate me, O LORD, for I have walked in my integrity, and I have trusted in the LORD without wavering.
verse_text: Psalms 25.1 Vnto the end the Psalme of Dauid. IVDGE me o Lord because I haue walked in my innocencie: and hoping in our Lord I shal not be weakened.

text: Psalms 26.1 OF DAVID. Vindicate me, O LORD, for I have walked in my integrity, and I have trusted in the LORD without wavering.
verse_text: Psalms 26.1 A Psalme of David. Judge me, O Lord, for I haue walked in mine innocency: my trust hath bene also in the Lord: therefore shall I not slide.

text: Psalms 26.1 OF DAVID. Vindicate me, O LORD, for I have walked in my integrity, and I have trusted in the LORD without wavering.
verse_text: Psalms 26.1 Iudge me, O Lord, for I haue walked in mine integritie: I haue trusted also in the Lord: therfore I shall not slide.

text: But as for me, I shall walk in my integrity; redeem me, and be gracious to me.
verse_text: Psalms 25.11 Ego autem in innocentia mea ingressus sum; redime me, et miserere mei.

text: Psalms 26.11 But as for me, I shall walk in my integrity; redeem me, and be gracious to me.
verse_text: Psalms 25.11 But I haue walked in mine innocencie: redeme me, and haue mercie on me.

text: Psalms 26.11 But as for me, I shall walk in my integrity; redeem me, and be gracious to me.
verse_text: Psalms 26.11 But I will walke in mine innocencie: redeeme me therefore, and be mercifull vnto me.

text: Psalms 26.11 But as for me, I shall walk in my integrity; redeem me, and be gracious to me.
verse_text: Psalms 26.11 But as for mee, I will walke in mine integritie: redeeme me, and bee mercifull vnto me.

text: When evildoers assail me to eat up my flesh, my adversaries and foes, it is they who stumble and fall.
verse_text: Psalms 26.2 Dum appropiant super me nocentes ut edant carnes meas, qui tribulant me inimici mei, ipsi infirmati sunt et ceciderunt.

text: Psalms 27.2 When evildoers assail me to eat up my flesh, my adversaries and foes, it is they who stumble and fall.
verse_text: Psalms 26.2 Whiles the harmeful approch vpon me, to eate my flesh. Mine enemies that truble me, them selues are weakened and are fallen.

text: Psalms 27.2 When evildoers assail me to eat up my flesh, my adversaries and foes, it is they who stumble and fall.
verse_text: Psalms 27.2 When the wicked, euen mine enemies and my foes came vpon mee to eate vp my flesh; they stumbled and fell.

text: Psalms 27.2 When evildoers assail me to eat up my flesh, my adversaries and foes, it is they who stumble and fall.
verse_text: Psalms 27.2 When the wicked, euen mine enemies and my foes came vpon me to eat vp my flesh, they stumbled and fell.

text: Though an army encamp against me, my heart shall not fear; though war arise against me, yet I will be confident.
verse_text: Psalms 26.3 Si consistant adversum me castra, non timebit cor meum; si exsurgat adversum me prælium, in hoc ego sperabo.

text: Psalms 27.3 Though an army encamp against me, my heart shall not fear; though war arise against me, yet I will be confident.
verse_text: Psalms 26.3 If campes stand together against me, my hart shal not feare. If battel rise vp against me, in this wil I hope.

text: Psalms 27.3 Though an army encamp against me, my heart shall not fear; though war arise against me, yet I will be confident.
verse_text: Psalms 27.3 Though an hoste pitched against me, mine heart should not be afraide: though warre be raised against me, I will trust in this.

text: Psalms 27.3 Though an army encamp against me, my heart shall not fear; though war arise against me, yet I will be confident.
verse_text: Psalms 27.3 Though an host should encampe against me, my heart shall not feare: though warre should rise against me, in this will I be confident.

text: One thing have I asked of the LORD, that will I seek after: that I may dwell in the house of the LORD all the days of my life, to gaze upon the beauty of the LORD and to inquire in his temple.
verse_text: Psalms 26.4 Unam petii a Domino, hanc requiram, ut inhabitem in domo Domini omnibus diebus vitæ meæ; ut videam voluptatem Domini, et visitem templum ejus.

text: Psalms 27.4 One thing have I asked of the LORD, that will I seek after: that I may dwell in the house of the LORD all the days of my life, to gaze upon the beauty of the LORD and to inquire in his temple.
verse_text: Psalms 26.4 One thing I haue asked of our Lord, this wil I seeke for, that I may dwel in the house of our Lord al the dayes of my life. That I may see the pleasentnes of our Lord, and visite his temple.

text: Psalms 27.4 One thing have I asked of the LORD, that will I seek after: that I may dwell in the house of the LORD all the days of my life, to gaze upon the beauty of the LORD and to inquire in his temple.
verse_text: Psalms 27.4 One thing haue I desired of the Lord, that I will require, euen that I may dwell in the house of the Lord all the dayes of my life, to beholde the beautie of the Lord, and to visite his Temple.

text: Psalms 27.4 One thing have I asked of the LORD, that will I seek after: that I may dwell in the house of the LORD all the days of my life, to gaze upon the beauty of the LORD and to inquire in his temple.
verse_text: Psalms 27.4 One thing haue I desired of the Lord, that will I seeke after: that I may dwel in the house of the Lord, all the dayes of my life, to behold the beautie of the Lord, and to inquire in his temple.

text: And now my head shall be lifted up above my enemies all around me, and I will offer in his tent sacrifices with shouts of joy; I will sing and make melody to the LORD.
verse_text: Psalms 26.6 In petra exaltavit me, et nunc exaltavit caput meum super inimicos meos. Circuivi, et immolavi in tabernaculo ejus hostiam vociferationis; cantabo, et psalmum dicam Domino.

text: Psalms 27.6 And now my head shall be lifted up above my enemies all around me, and I will offer in his tent sacrifices with shouts of joy; I will sing and make melody to the LORD.
verse_text: Psalms 26.6 In a rocke he hath exalted me: and now he hath exalted my head ouer mine enemies. I haue gone round about, and haue immolated in his tabernacle an host of iubilation: I wil sing, and say a Psalme to our Lord.

text: Psalms 27.6 And now my head shall be lifted up above my enemies all around me, and I will offer in his tent sacrifices with shouts of joy; I will sing and make melody to the LORD.
verse_text: Psalms 27.6 And nowe shall hee lift vp mine head aboue mine enemies rounde about mee: therefore wil I offer in his Tabernacle sacrifices of ioy: I wil sing and praise the Lord.

text: Psalms 27.6 And now my head shall be lifted up above my enemies all around me, and I will offer in his tent sacrifices with shouts of joy; I will sing and make melody to the LORD.
verse_text: Psalms 27.6 And now shall mine head be lifted vp aboue mine enemies round about me: therefore will I offer in his tabernacle sacrifices of ioy, I will sing, yea, I will sing praises vnto the Lord.

text: Wait for the LORD; be strong, and let your heart take courage; wait for the LORD!
verse_text: Psalms 26.14 Expecta Dominum, viriliter age: et confortetur cor tuum, et sustine Dominum.

text: Psalms 27.14 Wait for the LORD; be strong, and let your heart take courage; wait for the LORD!
verse_text: Psalms 26.14 Expect our Lord, doe manfully: and let thy hart take courage, and expect thou our Lord.

text: Psalms 27.14 Wait for the LORD; be strong, and let your heart take courage; wait for the LORD!
verse_text: Psalms 27.14 Hope in the Lord: be strong, and he shall comfort thine heart, and trust in the Lord.

text: Psalms 27.14 Wait for the LORD; be strong, and let your heart take courage; wait for the LORD!
verse_text: Psalms 27.14 Wait on the Lord: be of good courage, and he shall strengthen thine heart: wait, I say, on the Lord.

text: OF DAVID.To you, O LORD, I call; my rock, be not deaf to me, lest, if you be silent to me, I become like those who go down to the pit.
verse_text: Psalms 27.1 Psalmus ipsi David. Ad te, Domine, clamabo; Deus meus, ne sileas a me: nequando taceas a me, et assimilabor descendentibus in lacum.

text: Psalms 28.1 OF DAVID.To you, O LORD, I call; my rock, be not deaf to me, lest, if you be silent to me, I become like those who go down to the pit.
verse_text: Psalms 27.1 A Psalme to Dauid him selfe. TO THEE o Lord I wil crie, my God keepe not silence from me: lest at any time thou hold thy peace from me, and I shal be like to them that goe downe into the lake.

text: Psalms 28.1 OF DAVID.To you, O LORD, I call; my rock, be not deaf to me, lest, if you be silent to me, I become like those who go down to the pit.
verse_text: Psalms 28.1 A Psalme of David. Unto thee, O Lord, doe I crie: O my strength, be not deafe toward mee, lest, if thou answere me not, I be like them that goe downe into the pit.

text: Psalms 28.1 OF DAVID.To you, O LORD, I call; my rock, be not deaf to me, lest, if you be silent to me, I become like those who go down to the pit.
verse_text: Psalms 28.1 Vnto thee will I cry, O Lord, my rocke, be not silent to mee: lest if thou be silent to me, I become like them that goe downe into the pit.

text: Hear the voice of my pleas for mercy, when I cry to you for help, when I lift up my hands toward your most holy sanctuary.
verse_text: Psalms 27.2 Exaudi, Domine, vocem deprecationis meæ dum oro ad te; dum extollo manus meas ad templum sanctum tuum.

text: Psalms 28.2 Hear the voice of my pleas for mercy, when I cry to you for help, when I lift up my hands toward your most holy sanctuary.
verse_text: Psalms 27.2 Heare o Lord the voice of my petition whiles I pray to thee: whiles I lift vp my handes to thy holie temple.

text: Psalms 28.2 Hear the voice of my pleas for mercy, when I cry to you for help, when I lift up my hands toward your most holy sanctuary.
verse_text: Psalms 28.2 Heare the voyce of my petitions, when I crie vnto thee, when I holde vp mine handes towarde thine holy Oracle.

text: Psalms 28.2 Hear the voice of my pleas for mercy, when I cry to you for help, when I lift up my hands toward your most holy sanctuary.
verse_text: Psalms 28.2 Heare the voyce of my supplications, when I cry vnto thee: when I lift vp my handes toward thy holy Oracle.

text: Because they do not regard the works of the LORD or the work of his hands, he will tear them down and build them up no more.
verse_text: Psalms 27.5 Quoniam non intellexerunt opera Domini, et in opera manuum ejus destrues illos, et non ædificabis eos.

text: Psalms 28.5 Because they do not regard the works of the LORD or the work of his hands, he will tear them down and build them up no more.
verse_text: Psalms 27.5 Because they haue not vnderstood the workes of our Lord, and in the workes of his handes thou shalt destroy them, and not build them vp.

text: Psalms 28.5 Because they do not regard the works of the LORD or the work of his hands, he will tear them down and build them up no more.
verse_text: Psalms 28.5 For they regarde not the woorkes of the Lord, nor the operation of his handes: therefore breake them downe, and builde them not vp.

text: Psalms 28.5 Because they do not regard the works of the LORD or the work of his hands, he will tear them down and build them up no more.
verse_text: Psalms 28.5 Because they regard not the workes of the Lord, nor the operation of his hands, he shal destroy them, and not build them vp.

text: The LORD is my strength and my shield; in him my heart trusts, and I am helped; my heart exults, and with my song I give thanks to him.
verse_text: Psalms 27.7 Dominus adjutor meus et protector meus; in ipso speravit cor meum, et adjutus sum: et refloruit caro mea, et ex voluntate mea confitebor ei.

text: Psalms 28.7 The LORD is my strength and my shield; in him my heart trusts, and I am helped; my heart exults, and with my song I give thanks to him.
verse_text: Psalms 27.7 Our Lord is my helper, and my protectour: in him my hart hath hoped, and I was holpen. And my flesh florished againe: and with my wil I wil confesse to him.

text: Psalms 28.7 The LORD is my strength and my shield; in him my heart trusts, and I am helped; my heart exults, and with my song I give thanks to him.
verse_text: Psalms 28.7 The Lord is my strength and my shielde: mine heart trusted in him, and I was helped: therfore mine heart shall reioyce, and with my song will I praise him.

text: Psalms 28.7 The LORD is my strength and my shield; in him my heart trusts, and I am helped; my heart exults, and with my song I give thanks to him.
verse_text: Psalms 28.7 The Lord is my strength, and my shield, my heart trusted in him, and I am helped: therefore my heart greatly reioyceth, and with my song will I praise him.

text: The LORD is the strength of his people; he is the saving refuge of his anointed.

text: Psalms 28.8 The LORD is the strength of his people; he is the saving refuge of his anointed.

verse_text: Psalms 28.8 The Lord is their strength, and he is the strength of the deliuerances of his anointed.

text: Psalms 28.8 The LORD is the strength of his people; he is the saving refuge of his anointed.
verse_text: Psalms 28.8 The Lord is their strength, and hee is the sauing strength of his Anointed.

text: Ascribe to the LORD the glory due his name; worship the LORD in the splendor of holiness.

text: Psalms 29.2 Ascribe to the LORD the glory due his name; worship the LORD in the splendor of holiness.

text: Psalms 30.1 A PSALM OF DAVID. A SONG AT THE DEDICATION OF THE TEMPLE. I will extol you, O LORD, for you have drawn me up and have not let my foes rejoice over me.

text: For his anger is but for a moment, and his favor is for a lifetime. Weeping may tarry for the night, but joy comes with the morning.
verse_text: Psalms 30.5 For he endureth but a while in his anger: but in his fauour is life: weeping may abide at euening, but ioy commeth in the morning.

text: Psalms 30.5 For his anger is but for a moment, and his favor is for a lifetime. Weeping may tarry for the night, but joy comes with the morning.
verse_text: Psalms 30.5 For his anger endureth but a moment; in his fauour is life: weeping may endure for a night, but ioy commeth in the morning.

text: Psalms 31.1 TO THE CHOIRMASTER. A PSALM OF DAVID. In you, O LORD, do I take refuge; let me never be put to shame; in your righteousness deliver me!

text: Oh, how abundant is your goodness, which you have stored up for those who fear you and worked for those who take refuge in you, in the sight of the children of mankind!
verse_text: Psalms 30.20 Quam magna multitudo dulcedinis tuæ, Domine, quam abscondisti timentibus te; perfecisti eis qui sperant in te in conspectu filiorum hominum !
label: True

text: Psalms 31.19 Oh, how abundant is your goodness, which you have stored up for those who fear you and worked for those who take refuge in you, in the sight of the children of mankind!
verse_text: Psalms 30.20 How great is the multitude of thy sweetnesse o Lord, which thou hast hid for them that feare thee. Thou hast perfited it for them that hope in thee, in the sight of the children of men.
label: True

text: Psalms 31.19 Oh, how abundant is your goodness, which you have stored up for those who fear you and worked for those who take refuge in you, in the sight of the children of mankind!
verse_text: Psalms 31.19 Howe great is thy goodnesse, which thou hast layde vp for them, that feare thee! and done to them, that trust in thee, euen before the sonnes of men!

text: Psalms 31.19 Oh, how abundant is your goodness, which you have stored up for those who fear you and worked for those who take refuge in you, in the sight of the children of mankind!
verse_text: Psalms 31.19 O how great is thy goodnesse, which thou hast layd vp for them that feare thee: which thou hast wrought for them that trust in thee, before the sonnes of men!

text: Be strong, and let your heart take courage, all you who wait for the LORD!
verse_text: Psalms 30.25 Viriliter agite, et confortetur cor vestrum, omnes qui speratis in Domino.
label: True

text: Psalms 31.24 Be strong, and let your heart take courage, all you who wait for the LORD!
verse_text: Psalms 30.25 Do ye manfully, and let your hart take courage, al ye that hope in our Lord.
label: True

text: Psalms 31.24 Be strong, and let your heart take courage, all you who wait for the LORD!
verse_text: Psalms 31.24 All ye that trust in the Lord, be strong, and he shall establish your heart.

text: Psalms 31.24 Be strong, and let your heart take courage, all you who wait for the LORD!
verse_text: Psalms 31.24 Be of good courage, and hee shall strenghten your heart: all ye that hope in the Lord.

text: A MASKIL OF DAVID. Blessed is the one whose transgression is forgiven, whose sin is covered.
verse_text: Psalms 31.1 Ipsi David intellectus. Beati quorum remissæ sunt iniquitates, et quorum tecta sunt peccata.

text: Psalms 32.1 A MASKIL OF DAVID. Blessed is the one whose transgression is forgiven, whose sin is covered.
verse_text: Psalms 31.1 To Dauid him selfe vnderstanding. BLESSED are they, whose iniquities are forgeuen: and whose sinnes be couered.

text: Psalms 32.1 A MASKIL OF DAVID. Blessed is the one whose transgression is forgiven, whose sin is covered.
verse_text: Psalms 32.1 A Psalme of David to give instruction. Blessed is he whose wickednes is forgiuen, and whose sinne is couered.

text: Psalms 32.1 A MASKIL OF DAVID. Blessed is the one whose transgression is forgiven, whose sin is covered.
verse_text: Psalms 32.1 Blessed is he whose transgression is forgiuen, whose sinne is couered.

text: Blessed is the man against whom the LORD counts no iniquity, and in whose spirit there is no deceit.
verse_text: Psalms 31.2 Beatus vir cui non imputavit Dominus peccatum, nec est in spiritu ejus dolus.

text: Psalms 32.2 Blessed is the man against whom the LORD counts no iniquity, and in whose spirit there is no deceit.
verse_text: Psalms 31.2 Blessed is the man, to whom our Lord hath not imputed sinne, neither is there guile in his spirit.

text: Psalms 32.2 Blessed is the man against whom the LORD counts no iniquity, and in whose spirit there is no deceit.
verse_text: Psalms 32.2 Blessed is the man, vnto whom the Lord imputeth not iniquitie, and in whose spirite there is no guile.

text: Psalms 32.2 Blessed is the man against whom the LORD counts no iniquity, and in whose spirit there is no deceit.
verse_text: Psalms 32.2 Blessed is the man vnto whom the Lord imputeth not iniquitie: and in whose spirit there is no guile.

text: For day and night your hand was heavy upon me; my strength was dried up as by the heat of summer. Selah
verse_text: Psalms 31.4 Quoniam die ac nocte gravata est super me manus tua, conversus sum in ærumna mea, dum configitur spina.

text: Psalms 32.4 For day and night your hand was heavy upon me; my strength was dried up as by the heat of summer. Selah
verse_text: Psalms 32.4 (For thine hand is heauie vpon me, day and night: and my moysture is turned into ye drought of summer. Selah)

text: Psalms 32.4 For day and night your hand was heavy upon me; my strength was dried up as by the heat of summer. Selah
verse_text: Psalms 32.4 For day and night thy hand was heauy vpon me: my moisture is turned into the drought of summer. Selah.

text: I acknowledged my sin to you, and I did not cover my iniquity; I said, "I will confess my transgressions to the LORD," and you forgave the iniquity of my sin. Selah
verse_text: Psalms 31.5 Delictum meum cognitum tibi feci, et injustitiam meam non abscondi. Dixi: Confitebor adversum me injustitiam meam Domino; et tu remisisti impietatem peccati mei.

text: Psalms 32.5 I acknowledged my sin to you, and I did not cover my iniquity; I said, "I will confess my transgressions to the LORD," and you forgave the iniquity of my sin. Selah
verse_text: Psalms 31.5 I haue made my sinne knowen to thee: and my iniustice I haue not hid. I said: I wil confesse against me my iniustice to our Lord: and thou hast forgeuen the impietie of my sinne.

text: Psalms 32.5 I acknowledged my sin to you, and I did not cover my iniquity; I said, "I will confess my transgressions to the LORD," and you forgave the iniquity of my sin. Selah
verse_text: Psalms 32.5 Then I acknowledged my sinne vnto thee, neither hid I mine iniquitie: for I thought, I will confesse against my selfe my wickednesse vnto the Lord, and thou forgauest the punishment of my sinne. Selah.

text: Psalms 32.5 I acknowledged my sin to you, and I did not cover my iniquity; I said, "I will confess my transgressions to the LORD," and you forgave the iniquity of my sin. Selah
verse_text: Psalms 32.5 I acknowledged my sin vnto thee, and mine iniquitie haue I not hid: I said, I will confesse my transgressions vnto the Lord; and thou forgauest the iniquitie of my sinne. Selah.

text: Therefore let everyone who is godly offer prayer to you at a time when you may be found; surely in the rush of great waters, they shall not reach him.
verse_text: Psalms 31.6 Pro hac orabit ad te omnis sanctus in tempore opportuno. Verumtamen in diluvio aquarum multarum, ad eum non approximabunt.

text: Psalms 32.6 Therefore let everyone who is godly offer prayer to you at a time when you may be found; surely in the rush of great waters, they shall not reach him.
verse_text: Psalms 31.6 For this shal euerie holie one pray to thee, in time conuenient. But yet in the floud of manie waters, they shal not approche to him.

text: Psalms 32.6 Therefore let everyone who is godly offer prayer to you at a time when you may be found; surely in the rush of great waters, they shall not reach him.
verse_text: Psalms 32.6 Therefore shall euery one, that is godly, make his prayer vnto thee in a time, when thou mayest be founde: surely in the flood of great waters they shall not come neere him.

text: Psalms 32.6 Therefore let everyone who is godly offer prayer to you at a time when you may be found; surely in the rush of great waters, they shall not reach him.
verse_text: Psalms 32.6 For this shall euery one that is godly pray vnto thee, in a time when thou mayest bee found: surely in the floods of great waters, they shall not come nigh vnto him.

text: Sing to him a new song; play skillfully on the strings, with loud shouts.

text: Psalms 33.3 Sing to him a new song; play skillfully on the strings, with loud shouts.

verse_text: Psalms 33.3 Sing vnto him a newe song: sing cheerefully with a loude voyce.

text: Psalms 33.3 Sing to him a new song; play skillfully on the strings, with loud shouts.
verse_text: Psalms 33.3 Sing vnto him a new song; play skilfully with a loud noise.

text: Let all the earth fear the LORD; let all the inhabitants of the world stand in awe of him!

text: Psalms 33.8 Let all the earth fear the LORD; let all the inhabitants of the world stand in awe of him!
verse_text: Psalms 32.8 Let al the earth feare our Lord: and let al the inhabitantes of the world be moued at him.

text: Psalms 33.8 Let all the earth fear the LORD; let all the inhabitants of the world stand in awe of him!
verse_text: Psalms 33.8 Let all the earth feare the Lord: let al them that dwell in the world, feare him.

text: Psalms 33.8 Let all the earth fear the LORD; let all the inhabitants of the world stand in awe of him!
verse_text: Psalms 33.8 Let all the earth feare the Lord: let all the inhabitants of the world stand in awe of him.

text: The LORD brings the counsel of the nations to nothing; he frustrates the plans of the peoples.
verse_text: Psalms 32.10 Dominus dissipat consilia gentium; reprobat autem cogitationes populorum, et reprobat consilia principum.

text: Psalms 33.10 The LORD brings the counsel of the nations to nothing; he frustrates the plans of the peoples.

text: Psalms 33.10 The LORD brings the counsel of the nations to nothing; he frustrates the plans of the peoples.
verse_text: Psalms 33.10 The Lord breaketh the counsell of the heathen, and bringeth to nought the deuices of the people.

verse_text: Psalms 33.10 The Lord bringeth the counsell of the heathen to nought: he maketh the deuices of the people, of none effect.

text: The counsel of the LORD stands forever, the plans of his heart to all generations.

text: Psalms 33.11 The counsel of the LORD stands forever, the plans of his heart to all generations.

text: he who fashions the hearts of them all and observes all their deeds.

text: The king is not saved by his great army; a warrior is not delivered by his great strength.
verse_text: Psalms 32.16 Non salvatur rex per multam virtutem, et gigas non salvabitur in multitudine virtutis suæ.

text: Psalms 33.16 The king is not saved by his great army; a warrior is not delivered by his great strength.

text: Psalms 33.16 The king is not saved by his great army; a warrior is not delivered by his great strength.
verse_text: Psalms 33.16 The King is not saued by the multitude of an hoste, neither is the mightie man deliuered by great strength.

text: Psalms 33.16 The king is not saved by his great army; a warrior is not delivered by his great strength.
verse_text: Psalms 33.16 There is no king saued by the multitude of an hoste: a mightie man is not deliuered by much strength.

text: The war horse is a false hope for salvation, and by its great might it cannot rescue.

text: Psalms 33.17 The war horse is a false hope for salvation, and by its great might it cannot rescue.
verse_text: Psalms 33.17 An horse is a vaine thing for safetie: neither shall he deliuer any by his great strength.

text: Our soul waits for the LORD; he is our help and our shield.

text: Let your steadfast love, O LORD, be upon us, even as we hope in you.

text: Psalms 33.22 Let your steadfast love, O LORD, be upon us, even as we hope in you.
verse_text: Psalms 33.22 Let thy mercy (O Lord) be vpon vs: according as we hope in thee.

text: Oh, fear the LORD, you his saints, for those who fear him have no lack!

text: The young lions suffer want and hunger; but those who seek the LORD lack no good thing.

text: But at my stumbling they rejoiced and gathered; they gathered together against me; wretches whom I did not know tore at me without ceasing;
verse_text: Psalms 35.15 But in mine aduersitie they reioyced, and gathered them selues together: the abiects assembled themselues against me, and knewe not: they tare me and ceased not,

text: How long, O Lord, will you look on? Rescue me from their destruction, my precious life from the lions!
verse_text: Psalms 34.17 Domine, quando respicies? Restitue animam meam a malignitate eorum; a leonibus unicam meam.

text: Psalms 35.17 How long, O Lord, will you look on? Rescue me from their destruction, my precious life from the lions!
verse_text: Psalms 34.17 Lord when wilt thou regard? restore thou my soule from their malignitie, myne only one from the lions.

text: Psalms 35.17 How long, O Lord, will you look on? Rescue me from their destruction, my precious life from the lions!
verse_text: Psalms 35.17 Lord, how long wilt thou beholde this? deliuer my soule from their tumult, euen my desolate soule from the lions.

text: Psalms 35.17 How long, O Lord, will you look on? Rescue me from their destruction, my precious life from the lions!
verse_text: Psalms 35.17 Lord, how long wilt thou looke on? rescue my soule from their destructions, my darling from the lyons.

text: For they do not speak peace, but against those who are quiet in the land they devise words of deceit.
verse_text: Psalms 35.20 For they speake not as friendes: but they imagine deceitfull woordes against the quiet of the lande.

text: Awake and rouse yourself for my vindication, for my cause, my God and my Lord!

verse_text: Psalms 35.23 Stirre vp thy selfe and awake to my iudgement, euen vnto my cause, my God and my Lord.

text: Vindicate me, O LORD, my God, according to your righteousness, and let them not rejoice over me!

text: Psalms 35.24 Vindicate me, O LORD, my God, according to your righteousness, and let them not rejoice over me!

text: Psalms 35.24 Vindicate me, O LORD, my God, according to your righteousness, and let them not rejoice over me!
verse_text: Psalms 35.24 Iudge me, O Lord my God, according to thy righteousnesse, and let them not reioyce ouer mee.

text: Psalms 35.24 Vindicate me, O LORD, my God, according to your righteousness, and let them not rejoice over me!
verse_text: Psalms 35.24 Iudge me O Lord my God, according to thy righteousnesse, and let them not reioyce ouer me.

text: Let them be put to shame and disappointed altogether who rejoice at my calamity! Let them be clothed with shame and dishonor who magnify themselves against me!
verse_text: Psalms 34.26 Erubescant et revereantur simul qui gratulantur malis meis; induantur confusione et reverentia qui magna loquuntur super me.

text: Psalms 35.26 Let them be put to shame and disappointed altogether who rejoice at my calamity! Let them be clothed with shame and dishonor who magnify themselves against me!
verse_text: Psalms 34.26 Let them blush and be ashamed together, that reioyce at my euils. Let them be clothed with confusion and shame; that speake great things vpon me.

text: Psalms 35.26 Let them be put to shame and disappointed altogether who rejoice at my calamity! Let them be clothed with shame and dishonor who magnify themselves against me!
verse_text: Psalms 35.26 Let them bee confounded, and put to shame together, that reioyce at mine hurt: let them bee clothed with confusion and shame, that lift vp themselues against me.

text: Psalms 35.26 Let them be put to shame and disappointed altogether who rejoice at my calamity! Let them be clothed with shame and dishonor who magnify themselves against me!
verse_text: Psalms 35.26 Let them be ashamed and brought to confusion together, that reioyce at mine hurt: let them bee cloathed with shame and dishonour, that magnifie themselues against me.

text: Let those who delight in my righteousness shout for joy and be glad and say evermore, "Great is the LORD, who delights in the welfare of his servant!"
verse_text: Psalms 34.27 Exsultent et lætentur qui volunt justitiam meam; et dicant semper: Magnificetur Dominus, qui volunt pacem servi ejus.

text: Psalms 35.27 Let those who delight in my righteousness shout for joy and be glad and say evermore, "Great is the LORD, who delights in the welfare of his servant!"

text: Psalms 39.9 I am mute; I do not open my mouth, for it is you who have done it.
verse_text: Psalms 39.9 I was dumbe, I opened not my mouth; because thou diddest it.

text: Remove your stroke from me; I am spent by the hostility of your hand.
verse_text: Psalms 38.11 amove a me plagas tuas.
label: True

text: Psalms 39.10 Remove your stroke from me; I am spent by the hostility of your hand.
verse_text: Psalms 38.11 Remoue thy scourges from me.
label: True

text: Psalms 39.10 Remove your stroke from me; I am spent by the hostility of your hand.
verse_text: Psalms 39.10 Take thy plague away from mee: for I am consumed by the stroke of thine hand.

text: Psalms 39.10 Remove your stroke from me; I am spent by the hostility of your hand.
verse_text: Psalms 39.10 Remooue thy stroke away from mee: I am consumed by the blowe of thine hand.

text: Blessed is the man who makes the LORD his trust, who does not turn to the proud, to those who go astray after a lie!
verse_text: Psalms 39.5 Beatus vir cujus est nomen Domini spes ejus, et non respexit in vanitates et insanias falsas.
label: True

text: Psalms 40.4 Blessed is the man who makes the LORD his trust, who does not turn to the proud, to those who go astray after a lie!
verse_text: Psalms 40.4 Blessed is the man that maketh the Lord his trust, and regardeth not the proude, nor such as turne aside to lyes.

text: Psalms 40.4 Blessed is the man who makes the LORD his trust, who does not turn to the proud, to those who go astray after a lie!
verse_text: Psalms 40.4 Blessed is that man that maketh the Lord his truste: and respecteth not the proud, nor such as turne aside to lies.

text: You have multiplied, O LORD my God, your wondrous deeds and your thoughts toward us; none can compare with you! I will proclaim and tell of them, yet they are more than can be told.
verse_text: Psalms 39.6 Multa fecisti tu, Domine Deus meus, mirabilia tua; et cogitationibus tuis non est qui similis sit tibi. Annuntiavi et locutus sum: multiplicati sunt super numerum.
label: True

text: Psalms 40.5 You have multiplied, O LORD my God, your wondrous deeds and your thoughts toward us; none can compare with you! I will proclaim and tell of them, yet they are more than can be told.
verse_text: Psalms 39.6 Thou hast done manie thy meruelous thinges o Lord my God: & in thy cogitations there is none that may be like to thee. I haue declared and haue spoken: they multiplied aboue number.
label: True

text: Psalms 40.5 You have multiplied, O LORD my God, your wondrous deeds and your thoughts toward us; none can compare with you! I will proclaim and tell of them, yet they are more than can be told.
verse_text: Psalms 40.5 O Lord my God, thou hast made thy wonderfull workes so many, that none can count in order to thee thy thoughts toward vs: I would declare, and speake of them, but they are moe then I am able to expresse.

text: Psalms 40.5 You have multiplied, O LORD my God, your wondrous deeds and your thoughts toward us; none can compare with you! I will proclaim and tell of them, yet they are more than can be told.
verse_text: Psalms 40.5 Many, O Lord my God; are thy wonderfull workes which thou hast done, and thy thoughts, which are to vs ward: they cannot be reckoned vp in order vnto thee: if I would declare and speake of them, they are moe then can be numbred.

text: Sacrifice and offering you have not desired, but you have given me an open ear. Burnt offering and sin offering you have not required.
verse_text: Psalms 40.6 Sacrifice and offering thou didest not desire: (for mine eares hast thou prepared) burnt offring and sinne offering hast thou not required.

text: Psalms 40.6 Sacrifice and offering you have not desired, but you have given me an open ear. Burnt offering and sin offering you have not required.
verse_text: Psalms 40.6 Sacrifice and offering thou didst not desire, mine eares hast thou opened: burnt offering and sinne-offering hast thou not required.

text: For evils have encompassed me beyond number; my iniquities have overtaken me, and I cannot see;they are more than the hairs of my head; my heart fails me.
verse_text: Psalms 39.13 Quoniam circumdederunt me mala quorum non est numerus; comprehenderunt me iniquitates meæ, et non potui ut viderem. Multiplicatæ sunt super capillos capitis mei, et cor meum dereliquit me.
label: True

text: Psalms 40.12 For evils have encompassed me beyond number; my iniquities have overtaken me, and I cannot see;they are more than the hairs of my head; my heart fails me.
verse_text: Psalms 39.13 Because euils haue compassed me, which haue no number: mine iniquities haue ouertaken me, & I was not able to see. They are multiplied aboue the heares of my head: and my hart hath forsaken me.
label: True

text: Psalms 40.12 For evils have encompassed me beyond number; my iniquities have overtaken me, and I cannot see;they are more than the hairs of my head; my heart fails me.
verse_text: Psalms 40.12 For innumerable troubles haue compassed mee: my sinnes haue taken such holde vpon me, that I am not able to looke vp: yea, they are moe in nomber then the heares of mine head: therefore mine heart hath failed me.

text: Psalms 40.12 For evils have encompassed me beyond number; my iniquities have overtaken me, and I cannot see;they are more than the hairs of my head; my heart fails me.
verse_text: Psalms 40.12 For innumerable euils haue compassed me about, mine iniquities haue taken hold vpon me, so that I am not able to looke vp: they are moe then the haires of mine head, therefore my heart faileth me.

text: Be pleased, O LORD, to deliver me! O LORD, make haste to help me!
verse_text: Psalms 39.14 Complaceat tibi, Domine, ut eruas me; Domine, ad adjuvandum me respice.
label: True

text: Psalms 40.13 Be pleased, O LORD, to deliver me! O LORD, make haste to help me!
verse_text: Psalms 39.14 It may please thee o Lord to deliuer me: Lord haue respect to helpe me.
label: True

text: Psalms 40.13 Be pleased, O LORD, to deliver me! O LORD, make haste to help me!
verse_text: Psalms 40.13 Let it please thee, O Lord, to deliuer mee: make haste, O Lord, to helpe me.

text: Psalms 40.13 Be pleased, O LORD, to deliver me! O LORD, make haste to help me!
verse_text: Psalms 40.13 Be pleased, O Lord, to deliuer me: O Lord, make haste to helpe me.

text: Let those be put to shame and disappointed altogether who seek to snatch away my life; let those be turned back and brought to dishonor who desire my hurt!
verse_text: Psalms 39.15 Confundantur et revereantur simul, qui quærunt animam meam ut auferant eam; convertantur retrorsum et revereantur, qui volunt mihi mala.
label: True

text: Psalms 40.14 Let those be put to shame and disappointed altogether who seek to snatch away my life; let those be turned back and brought to dishonor who desire my hurt!
verse_text: Psalms 39.15 Let them be confounded and ashamed together, that seeke my soule, to take it away. Let them be turned backward, and be ashamed that wil me euils.
label: True

text: Psalms 40.14 Let those be put to shame and disappointed altogether who seek to snatch away my life; let those be turned back and brought to dishonor who desire my hurt!
verse_text: Psalms 40.14 Let them be confounded and put to shame together, that seeke my soule to destroye it: let them be driuen backward and put to rebuke, that desire mine hurt.

text: Psalms 40.14 Let those be put to shame and disappointed altogether who seek to snatch away my life; let those be turned back and brought to dishonor who desire my hurt!
verse_text: Psalms 40.14 Let them be ashamed and confounded together, that seeke after my soule to destroy it: let them be driuen backward, and put to shame, that wish me euill.

text: And when one comes to see me, he utters empty words, while his heart gathers iniquity; when he goes out, he tells it abroad.
verse_text: Psalms 41.6 And if hee come to see mee, hee speaketh lies, but his heart heapeth iniquitie within him, and when he commeth foorth, he telleth it.

text: Psalms 41.6 And when one comes to see me, he utters empty words, while his heart gathers iniquity; when he goes out, he tells it abroad.
verse_text: Psalms 41.6 And if hee come to see me, he speaketh vanity: his heart gathereth iniquitie to it selfe, when he goeth abroad, he telleth it.

text: All who hate me whisper together about me; they imagine the worst for me.
verse_text: Psalms 40.8 In idipsum adversum me susurrabant omnes inimici mei; adversum me cogitabant mala mihi.
label: True

text: Psalms 41.7 All who hate me whisper together about me; they imagine the worst for me.
verse_text: Psalms 40.8 Al mine enemies whispered against me: they did thinke euils to me.
label: True

text: Psalms 41.7 All who hate me whisper together about me; they imagine the worst for me.
verse_text: Psalms 41.7 All they that hate me, whisper together against me: euen against me do they imagine mine hurt.

text: Psalms 41.7 All who hate me whisper together about me; they imagine the worst for me.
verse_text: Psalms 41.7 All that hate me, whisper together against me; against me doe they deuise my hurt.

text: They say, "A deadly thing is poured out on him; he will not rise again from where he lies."
verse_text: Psalms 41.8 A mischiefe is light vpon him, and he that lyeth, shall no more rise.

text: Psalms 41.8 They say, "A deadly thing is poured out on him; he will not rise again from where he lies."
verse_text: Psalms 41.8 An euill disease, say they, cleaueth fast vnto him; and now that he lyeth, he shall rise vp no more.

text: Blessed be the LORD, the God of Israel, from everlasting to everlasting! Amen and Amen. BOOK TWO
verse_text: Psalms 40.14 Benedictus Dominus Deus Israël a sæculo et usque in sæculum. Fiat, fiat.
label: True

text: Psalms 41.13 Blessed be the LORD, the God of Israel, from everlasting to everlasting! Amen and Amen. BOOK TWO
verse_text: Psalms 40.14 Blessed be our Lord the God of Israel from the beginning of the world, and for euermore: Be it, be it.
label: True

text: Psalms 41.13 Blessed be the LORD, the God of Israel, from everlasting to everlasting! Amen and Amen. BOOK TWO
verse_text: Psalms 41.13 Blessed be the Lord God of Israel worlde without ende. So be it, euen so be it.

text: Psalms 41.13 Blessed be the LORD, the God of Israel, from everlasting to everlasting! Amen and Amen. BOOK TWO
verse_text: Psalms 41.13 Blessed bee the Lord God of Israel, from euerlasting, and to euerlasting. Amen, and Amen.

text: and my God. My soul is cast down within me; therefore I remember you from the land of Jordan and of Hermon, from Mount Mizar.
verse_text: Psalms 41.7 et Deus meus. Ad meipsum anima mea conturbata est: propterea memor ero tui de terra Jordanis et Hermoniim a monte modico.
label: True

text: Psalms 42.6 and my God. My soul is cast down within me; therefore I remember you from the land of Jordan and of Hermon, from Mount Mizar.
verse_text: Psalms 41.7 and my God. My soule is trubled toward my selfe; therfore wil I be mindful of thee from the land of Iordan, and Hermoniim from the litle mountaine.
label: True

text: Psalms 42.6 and my God. My soul is cast down within me; therefore I remember you from the land of Jordan and of Hermon, from Mount Mizar.
verse_text: Psalms 42.6 My God, my soule is cast downe within me, because I remember thee, from the land of Iorden, and Hermonim, and from the mount Mizar.

text: Psalms 42.6 and my God. My soul is cast down within me; therefore I remember you from the land of Jordan and of Hermon, from Mount Mizar.
verse_text: Psalms 42.6 O my God, my soule is cast downe within me: therefore will I remember thee from the land of Iordane, and of the Hermonites, from the hill Missar.

text: As with a deadly wound in my bones, my adversaries taunt me, while they say to me continually, "Where is your God?"
verse_text: Psalms 41.11 Dum confringuntur ossa mea, exprobraverunt mihi qui tribulant me inimici mei, dum dicunt mihi per singulos dies: Ubi est Deus tuus?
label: True

text: Psalms 42.10 As with a deadly wound in my bones, my adversaries taunt me, while they say to me continually, "Where is your God?"
verse_text: Psalms 41.11 Whiles my bones are broken, mine enemies that truble me haue vpbrayded me: Whiles they say to me day by day: Where is thy God?
label: True

text: Psalms 42.10 As with a deadly wound in my bones, my adversaries taunt me, while they say to me continually, "Where is your God?"
verse_text: Psalms 42.10 My bones are cut asunder, while mine enemies reproch me, saying dayly vnto me, Where is thy God?

text: Psalms 42.10 As with a deadly wound in my bones, my adversaries taunt me, while they say to me continually, "Where is your God?"
verse_text: Psalms 42.10 As with a sword in my bones, mine enemies reproch mee: while they say dayly vnto me, Where is thy God?

text: Then I will go to the altar of God, to God my exceeding joy, and I will praise you with the lyre, O God, my God.
verse_text: Psalms 42.4 Et introibo ad altare Dei, ad Deum qui lætificat juventutem meam. Confitebor tibi in cithara, Deus, Deus meus.

text: Psalms 43.4 Then I will go to the altar of God, to God my exceeding joy, and I will praise you with the lyre, O God, my God.
verse_text: Psalms 43.4 Then wil I go vnto the altar of God, euen vnto the God of my ioy and gladnes: and vpon the harpe wil I giue thanks vnto thee, O God, my God.

text: Psalms 43.4 Then I will go to the altar of God, to God my exceeding joy, and I will praise you with the lyre, O God, my God.
verse_text: Psalms 43.4 Then will I goe vnto the Altar of God, vnto God my exceeding ioy: yea vpon the harpe will I praise thee, O God, my God.

text: Why are you cast down, O my soul, and why are you in turmoil within me? Hope in God; for I shall again praise him, my salvation and my God.
verse_text: Psalms 42.5 Quare tristis es, anima mea? et quare conturbas me? Spera in Deo, quoniam adhuc confitebor illi, salutare vultus mei, et Deus meus.

text: Psalms 43.5 Why are you cast down, O my soul, and why are you in turmoil within me? Hope in God; for I shall again praise him, my salvation and my God.
verse_text: Psalms 42.6 Hope in God, because yet wil I cōfesse to him: the saluation of my countenance, and my God.
label: True

text: Psalms 43.5 Why are you cast down, O my soul, and why are you in turmoil within me? Hope in God; for I shall again praise him, my salvation and my God.
verse_text: Psalms 43.5 Why art thou cast downe, my soule? and why art thou disquieted within mee? waite on God: for I will yet giue him thankes, he is my present helpe, and my God.

text: Psalms 43.5 Why are you cast down, O my soul, and why are you in turmoil within me? Hope in God; for I shall again praise him, my salvation and my God.
verse_text: Psalms 43.5 Why art thou cast downe, O my soule? and why art thou disquieted within me? hope in God, for I shall yet praise him, who is the health of my countenance, and my God.

text: you with your own hand drove out the nations, but them you planted; you afflicted the peoples, but them you set free;

text: Psalms 44.2 you with your own hand drove out the nations, but them you planted; you afflicted the peoples, but them you set free;

text: Psalms 44.2 you with your own hand drove out the nations, but them you planted; you afflicted the peoples, but them you set free;
verse_text: Psalms 44.2 Howe thou hast driuen out the heathen with thine hand, and planted them: how thou hast destroyed the people, and caused them to grow.

text: Psalms 44.2 you with your own hand drove out the nations, but them you planted; you afflicted the peoples, but them you set free;
verse_text: Psalms 44.2 How thou didst driue out the heathen with thy hand, & plantedst them; how thou didst afflict the people, and cast them out.

text: You are my King, O God; ordain salvation for Jacob!

label: True

text: Psalms 44.4 You are my King, O God; ordain salvation for Jacob!

verse_text: Psalms 44.4 Thou art my King, O God: send helpe vnto Iaakob.

text: Psalms 44.4 You are my King, O God; ordain salvation for Jacob!
verse_text: Psalms 44.4 Thou art my King, O God: command deliuerances for Iacob.

text: You have sold your people for a trifle, demanding no high price for them.
verse_text: Psalms 43.13 Vendidisti populum tuum sine pretio, et non fuit multitudo in commutationibus eorum.
label: True

text: Psalms 44.12 You have sold your people for a trifle, demanding no high price for them.
verse_text: Psalms 44.12 Thou sellest thy people without gaine, and doest not increase their price.

text: Psalms 44.12 You have sold your people for a trifle, demanding no high price for them.
verse_text: Psalms 44.12 Thou sellest thy people for nought, and doest not increase thy wealth by their price.

text: You have made us the taunt of our neighbors, the derision and scorn of those around us.

text: All this has come upon us, though we have not forgotten you, and we have not been false to your covenant.

label: True

text: Psalms 44.17 All this has come upon us, though we have not forgotten you, and we have not been false to your covenant.

label: True

text: Psalms 44.17 All this has come upon us, though we have not forgotten you, and we have not been false to your covenant.
verse_text: Psalms 44.17 All this is come vpon vs, yet doe wee not forget thee, neither deale wee falsly concerning thy couenant.

text: Psalms 44.17 All this has come upon us, though we have not forgotten you, and we have not been false to your covenant.
verse_text: Psalms 44.17 All this is come vpon vs; yet haue wee not forgotten thee, neither haue we dealt falsly in thy couenant.

text: Our heart has not turned back, nor have our steps departed from your way;
verse_text: Psalms 44.18 Our heart is not turned backe: neither our steps gone out of thy paths,

text: Psalms 44.18 Our heart has not turned back, nor have our steps departed from your way;
verse_text: Psalms 44.18 Our heart is not turned backe: neither haue our steps declined from thy way,

text: yet you have broken us in the place of jackals and covered us with the shadow of death.
verse_text: Psalms 43.20 quoniam humiliasti nos in loco afflictionis, et cooperuit nos umbra mortis.
label: True

text: Psalms 44.19 yet you have broken us in the place of jackals and covered us with the shadow of death.

text: Psalms 44.19 yet you have broken us in the place of jackals and covered us with the shadow of death.

text: Psalms 44.19 yet you have broken us in the place of jackals and covered us with the shadow of death.
verse_text: Psalms 44.19 Though thou hast sore broken vs in the place of dragons, and couered vs with the shadow of death.

text: Why do you hide your face? Why do you forget our affliction and oppression?
verse_text: Psalms 43.24 Quare faciem tuam avertis? oblivisceris inopiæ nostræ et tribulationis nostræ?

text: Psalms 44.24 Why do you hide your face? Why do you forget our affliction and oppression?
verse_text: Psalms 43.24 Why dost thou turne away thy face, forgettest our pouertie and our tribulation?

text: Psalms 44.24 Why do you hide your face? Why do you forget our affliction and oppression?

text: Psalms 44.24 Why do you hide your face? Why do you forget our affliction and oppression?

text: TO THE CHOIRMASTER: ACCORDING TO LILIES. A MASKIL OF THE SONS OF KORAH; A LOVE SONG. My heart overflows with a pleasing theme; I address my verses to the king; my tongue is like the pen of a ready scribe.
verse_text: Psalms 44.2 Eructavit cor meum verbum bonum: dico ego opera mea regi. Lingua mea calamus scribæ velociter scribentis.
label: True

text: Psalms 45.1 TO THE CHOIRMASTER: ACCORDING TO LILIES. A MASKIL OF THE SONS OF KORAH; A LOVE SONG. My heart overflows with a pleasing theme; I address my verses to the king; my tongue is like the pen of a ready scribe.
verse_text: Psalms 44.2 MY hart hath vttered a good word: I tel my workes to the king. My tongue is the penne of a scribe, that writeth swiftly.

text: Psalms 45.1 TO THE CHOIRMASTER: ACCORDING TO LILIES. A MASKIL OF THE SONS OF KORAH; A LOVE SONG. My heart overflows with a pleasing theme; I address my verses to the king; my tongue is like the pen of a ready scribe.
verse_text: Psalms 45.1 To him that excelleth on Shoshannim a song of love to give instruction, committed to the sonnes of Korah. Mine heart will vtter forth a good matter: I wil intreat in my workes of the King: my tongue is as the pen of a swift writer.

text: Psalms 45.1 TO THE CHOIRMASTER: ACCORDING TO LILIES. A MASKIL OF THE SONS OF KORAH; A LOVE SONG. My heart overflows with a pleasing theme; I address my verses to the king; my tongue is like the pen of a ready scribe.
verse_text: Psalms 45.1 My heart is inditing a good matter: I speake of the things which I haue made, touching the King: my tongue is the penne of a ready writer.

text: Gird your sword on your thigh, O mighty one, in your splendor and majesty!
verse_text: Psalms 44.4 Accingere gladio tuo super femur tuum, potentissime.
label: True

text: Psalms 45.3 Gird your sword on your thigh, O mighty one, in your splendor and majesty!
verse_text: Psalms 44.4 Be girded with thy sword vpon thy thigh, o most mightie.
label: True

text: Psalms 45.3 Gird your sword on your thigh, O mighty one, in your splendor and majesty!
verse_text: Psalms 45.3 Gird thy sword vpon thy thigh, O most mightie, to wit, thy worship and thy glory,

text: Psalms 45.3 Gird your sword on your thigh, O mighty one, in your splendor and majesty!
verse_text: Psalms 45.3 Gird thy sword vpon thy thigh, O most mightie: with thy glory and thy maiestie.

text: In your majesty ride out victoriously for the cause of truth and meekness and righteousness; let your right hand teach you awesome deeds!
verse_text: Psalms 44.5 Specie tua et pulchritudine tua intende, prospere procede, et regna, propter veritatem, et mansuetudinem, et justitiam; et deducet te mirabiliter dextera tua.
label: True

text: Psalms 45.4 In your majesty ride out victoriously for the cause of truth and meekness and righteousness; let your right hand teach you awesome deeds!
verse_text: Psalms 45.4 And prosper with thy glory: ride vpon the worde of trueth and of meekenes and of righteousnes: so thy right hand shall teach thee terrible things.

text: Psalms 45.4 In your majesty ride out victoriously for the cause of truth and meekness and righteousness; let your right hand teach you awesome deeds!
verse_text: Psalms 45.4 And in thy maiestie ride prosperously, because of trueth and meekenes, and righteousnesse: and thy right hand shall teach thee terrible things.

text: Your throne, O God, is forever and ever. The scepter of your kingdom is a scepter of uprightness;
verse_text: Psalms 44.7 Sedes tua, Deus, in sæculum sæculi; virga directionis virga regni tui.
label: True

text: Psalms 45.6 Your throne, O God, is forever and ever. The scepter of your kingdom is a scepter of uprightness;

verse_text: Psalms 49.1 Psalmus Asaph. Deus deorum Dominus locutus est, et vocavit terram a solis ortu usque ad occasum.

text: Psalms 50.1 A PSALM OF ASAPH. The Mighty One, God the LORD, speaks and summons the earth from the rising of the sun to its setting.
verse_text: Psalms 49.1 A Psalme to Asaph. THE God of goddes our Lord hath spoken: and he hath called the earth, from the rysing of the sunne euen to the going downe.

text: Psalms 50.1 A PSALM OF ASAPH. The Mighty One, God the LORD, speaks and summons the earth from the rising of the sun to its setting.
verse_text: Psalms 50.1 A Psalme of Asaph. The God of Gods, euen the Lord hath spoken and called the earth from the rising vp of the sunne vnto the going downe thereof.

text: Psalms 50.1 A PSALM OF ASAPH. The Mighty One, God the LORD, speaks and summons the earth from the rising of the sun to its setting.
verse_text: Psalms 50.1 The mightie God, euen the Lord hath spoken, and called the earth from the rising of the sunne, vnto the going downe thereof.

text: Our God comes; he does not keep silence; before him is a devouring fire, around him a mighty tempest.
verse_text: Psalms 49.3 Deus manifeste veniet; Deus noster, et non silebit. Ignis in conspectu ejus exardescet; et in circuitu ejus tempestas valida.

text: Psalms 50.3 Our God comes; he does not keep silence; before him is a devouring fire, around him a mighty tempest.
verse_text: Psalms 49.3 God wil come manifestly: our God and he wil not kepe silence. Fire shal burne forth in his sight: and round about him a mighty tempest.

text: Psalms 50.3 Our God comes; he does not keep silence; before him is a devouring fire, around him a mighty tempest.
verse_text: Psalms 50.3 Our God shall come and shall not keepe silence: a fire shall deuoure before him, and a mightie tempest shall be mooued round about him.

text: Psalms 50.3 Our God comes; he does not keep silence; before him is a devouring fire, around him a mighty tempest.
verse_text: Psalms 50.3 Our God shall come, and shall not keepe silence: a fire shall deuoure before him, and it shalbe very tempestuous round about him.

text: The heavens declare his righteousness, for God himself is judge! Selah
verse_text: Psalms 49.6 Et annuntiabunt cæli justitiam ejus, quoniam Deus judex est.

text: Psalms 50.6 The heavens declare his righteousness, for God himself is judge! Selah
verse_text: Psalms 49.6 And the heauens shal shew forth his iustice: because God is Iudge.

text: Psalms 50.6 The heavens declare his righteousness, for God himself is judge! Selah
verse_text: Psalms 50.6 And the heauens shall declare his righteousnes: for God is iudge himselfe. Selah.

text: Psalms 50.6 The heavens declare his righteousness, for God himself is judge! Selah
verse_text: Psalms 50.6 And the heauens shall declare his righteousnes; for God is iudge himselfe. Selah.

text: Not for your sacrifices do I rebuke you; your burnt offerings are continually before me.
verse_text: Psalms 49.8 Non in sacrificiis tuis arguam te; holocausta autem tua in conspectu meo sunt semper.

text: Psalms 50.8 Not for your sacrifices do I rebuke you; your burnt offerings are continually before me.
verse_text: Psalms 49.8 I wil not rebuke thee in thy sacrifices: and thy holocaustes are in my sight alwaies.

text: Psalms 50.8 Not for your sacrifices do I rebuke you; your burnt offerings are continually before me.
verse_text: Psalms 50.8 I will not reproue thee for thy sacrifices, or thy burnt offerings, to haue bene continually before me.

text: I will not accept a bull from your house or goats from your folds.
verse_text: Psalms 49.9 Non accipiam de domo tua vitulos, neque de gregibus tuis hircos:

text: Psalms 50.9 I will not accept a bull from your house or goats from your folds.
verse_text: Psalms 49.9 I wil not take calues out of thy house: nor buckegoats out of thy flockes.

text: Psalms 50.9 I will not accept a bull from your house or goats from your folds.
verse_text: Psalms 50.9 I will take no bullocke out of thine house, nor goates out of thy foldes.

text: Psalms 50.9 I will not accept a bull from your house or goats from your folds.
verse_text: Psalms 50.9 I will take no bullocke out of thy house, nor hee goates out of thy folds.

text: I know all the birds of the hills, and all that moves in the field is mine.
verse_text: Psalms 49.11 Cognovi omnia volatilia cæli, et pulchritudo agri mecum est.

text: Psalms 50.11 I know all the birds of the hills, and all that moves in the field is mine.
verse_text: Psalms 49.11 I haue knowne al the foules of the ayer: and the beauty of the fielde is with me.

text: Psalms 50.11 I know all the birds of the hills, and all that moves in the field is mine.
verse_text: Psalms 50.11 I knowe all the foules on the mountaines: and the wilde beastes of the fielde are mine.

text: Psalms 50.11 I know all the birds of the hills, and all that moves in the field is mine.
verse_text: Psalms 50.11 I know all the foules of the mountaines: and the wild beasts of the field are mine.

text: Offer to God a sacrifice of thanksgiving, and perform your vows to the Most High,
verse_text: Psalms 49.14 Immola Deo sacrificium laudis, et redde Altissimo vota tua.

text: Psalms 50.14 Offer to God a sacrifice of thanksgiving, and perform your vows to the Most High,
verse_text: Psalms 49.14 Immolate to God the sacrifice of praise, and pay thy vowes to the Highest.
