verse_text: Psalms 50.15 And call vpon mee in the day of trouble; I will deliuer thee, and thou shalt glorifie me.

text: For you hate discipline, and you cast my words behind you.

text: Psalms 50.17 For you hate discipline, and you cast my words behind you.

text: Psalms 50.17 For you hate discipline, and you cast my words behind you.
verse_text: Psalms 50.17 Seeing thou hatest instruction, and castest my words behinde thee.

text: If you see a thief, you are pleased with him, and you keep company with adulterers.
verse_text: Psalms 49.18 Si videbas furem, currebas cum eo; et cum adulteris portionem tuam ponebas.

text: Psalms 50.18 If you see a thief, you are pleased with him, and you keep company with adulterers.
verse_text: Psalms 49.18 If thou didst see a theefe, thou didst rune with him: and with adulterers thou didst put thy portion.

text: Psalms 50.18 If you see a thief, you are pleased with him, and you keep company with adulterers.
verse_text: Psalms 50.18 For when thou seest a thiefe, thou runnest with him, and thou art partaker with the adulterers.

text: Psalms 50.18 If you see a thief, you are pleased with him, and you keep company with adulterers.
verse_text: Psalms 50.18 When thou sawest a thiefe, then thou consentedst with him, and hast bene partaker with adulterers.

text: You sit and speak against your brother; you slander your own mother's son.
verse_text: Psalms 49.20 Sedens adversus fratrem tuum loquebaris, et adversus filium matris tuæ ponebas scandalum.

text: Psalms 50.20 You sit and speak against your brother; you slander your own mother's son.
verse_text: Psalms 49.20 Sitting thou spakest against thy brother, and against thy mothers sonne thou didst put a scandal:

text: Psalms 50.20 You sit and speak against your brother; you slander your own mother's son.
verse_text: Psalms 50.20 Thou sittest, and speakest against thy brother, and slanderest thy mothers sonne.

text: Psalms 50.20 You sit and speak against your brother; you slander your own mother's son.
verse_text: Psalms 50.20 Thou sittest and speakest against thy brother; thou slanderest thine owne mothers sonne.

text: TO THE CHOIRMASTER. A PSALM OF DAVID, WHEN NATHAN THE PROPHET WENT TO HIM, AFTER HE HAD GONE IN TO BATHSHEBA. Have mercy on me, O God, according to your steadfast love; according to your abundant mercy blot out my transgressions.
verse_text: Psalms 51.1 To him that excelleth. A Psalme of David, when the Prophet Nathan came unto him, after he had gone in to Bath-sheba. Have mercie vpon me, O God, according to thy louing kindnes: according to the multitude of thy compassions put away mine iniquities.

text: Psalms 51.1 TO THE CHOIRMASTER. A PSALM OF DAVID, WHEN NATHAN THE PROPHET WENT TO HIM, AFTER HE HAD GONE IN TO BATHSHEBA. Have mercy on me, O God, according to your steadfast love; according to your abundant mercy blot out my transgressions.
verse_text: Psalms 51.1 Haue mercie vpon mee, O God, according to thy louing kindnesse: according vnto the multitude of thy tender mercies blot out my transgressions.

text: Against you, you only, have I sinned and done what is evil in your sight, so that you may be justified in your words and blameless in your judgment.
verse_text: Psalms 51.4 Against thee, against thee onely haue I sinned, and done euill in thy sight, that thou mayest be iust when thou speakest, and pure when thou iudgest.

text: Psalms 51.4 Against you, you only, have I sinned and done what is evil in your sight, so that you may be justified in your words and blameless in your judgment.
verse_text: Psalms 51.4 Against thee, thee onely haue I sinned, and done this euill in thy sight: that thou mightest bee iustified when thou speakest, and be cleare when thou iudgest.

text: Let me hear joy and gladness; let the bones that you have broken rejoice.
verse_text: Psalms 51.8 Make me to heare ioye and gladnes, that the bones, which thou hast broken, may reioyce.

text: Psalms 51.8 Let me hear joy and gladness; let the bones that you have broken rejoice.
verse_text: Psalms 51.8 Make mee to heare ioy and gladnesse: that the bones which thou hast broken, may reioyce.

text: Hide your face from my sins, and blot out all my iniquities.
verse_text: Psalms 51.9 Hide thy face from my sinnes, and put away all mine iniquities.

text: Psalms 51.9 Hide your face from my sins, and blot out all my iniquities.
verse_text: Psalms 51.9 Hide thy face from my sinnes; and blot out all mine iniquities.

text: Deliver me from bloodguiltiness, O God, O God of my salvation, and my tongue will sing aloud of your righteousness.
verse_text: Psalms 51.14 Deliuer me from blood, O God, which art the God of my saluation, and my tongue shall sing ioyfully of thy righteousnes.

text: Psalms 51.14 Deliver me from bloodguiltiness, O God, O God of my salvation, and my tongue will sing aloud of your righteousness.
verse_text: Psalms 51.14 Deliuer mee from blood-guiltinesse, O God, thou God of my saluation: and my tongue shall sing alowd of thy righteousnesse.

text: The sacrifices of God are a broken spirit; a broken and contrite heart, O God, you will not despise.
verse_text: Psalms 51.17 The sacrifices of God are a contrite spirit: a contrite and a broken heart, O God, thou wilt not despise.

text: Psalms 51.17 The sacrifices of God are a broken spirit; a broken and contrite heart, O God, you will not despise.
verse_text: Psalms 51.17 The sacrifices of God are a broken spirit: a broken and a contrite heart, O God, thou wilt not despise.

text: Do good to Zion in your good pleasure; build up the walls of Jerusalem;
verse_text: Psalms 51.18 Bee fauourable vnto Zion for thy good pleasure: builde the walles of Ierusalem.

text: Psalms 51.18 Do good to Zion in your good pleasure; build up the walls of Jerusalem;
verse_text: Psalms 51.18 Doe good in thy good pleasure vnto Sion: build thou the walles of Ierusalem.

text: then will you delight in right sacrifices, in burnt offerings and whole burnt offerings; then bulls will be offered on your altar.
verse_text: Psalms 51.19 Then shalt thou accept ye sacrifices of righteousnes, euen the burnt offering and oblation: then shall they offer calues vpon thine altar.

text: Psalms 51.19 then will you delight in right sacrifices, in burnt offerings and whole burnt offerings; then bulls will be offered on your altar.
verse_text: Psalms 51.19 Then shalt thou be pleased with the sacrifices of righteousnesse, with burnt offering and whole burnt offering: then shall they offer bullockes vpon thine altar.

text: TO THE CHOIRMASTER. A MASKIL OF DAVID, WHEN DOEG, THE EDOMITE, CAME AND TOLD SAUL, "DAVID HAS COME TO THE HOUSE OF AHIMELECH." Why do you boast of evil, O mighty man? The steadfast love of God endures all the day.
verse_text: Psalms 52.1 To him that excelleth. A Psalme of Dauid to giue instruction. When Doeg the Edomite came and shewed Saul, and saide to him, Dauid is come to the house of Abimelech. Why boastest thou thy selfe in thy wickednesse, O man of power? the louing kindenesse of God indureth dayly.

text: Psalms 52.1 TO THE CHOIRMASTER. A MASKIL OF DAVID, WHEN DOEG, THE EDOMITE, CAME AND TOLD SAUL, "DAVID HAS COME TO THE HOUSE OF AHIMELECH." Why do you boast of evil, O mighty man? The steadfast love of God endures all the day.
verse_text: Psalms 52.1 Why boastest thou thy selfe in mischiefe, O mightie man? the goodnesse of God indureth continually.

text: Your tongue plots destruction, like a sharp razor, you worker of deceit.
verse_text: Psalms 52.2 Thy tongue imagineth mischiefe, and is like a sharpe rasor, that cutteth deceitfully.

text: Psalms 52.2 Your tongue plots destruction, like a sharp razor, you worker of deceit.
verse_text: Psalms 52.2 Thy tongue deuiseth mischiefes: like a sharpe rasor, working deceitfully.

text: There they are, in great terror, where there is no terror! For God scatters the bones of him who encamps against you; you put them to shame, for God has rejected them.

text: Psalms 53.5 There they are, in great terror, where there is no terror! For God scatters the bones of him who encamps against you; you put them to shame, for God has rejected them.

text: Oh, that salvation for Israel would come out of Zion! When God restores the fortunes of his people, Let Jacob rejoice, let Israel be glad.

label: True

text: Psalms 53.6 Oh, that salvation for Israel would come out of Zion! When God restores the fortunes of his people, Let Jacob rejoice, let Israel be glad.

label: True

text: Psalms 53.6 Oh, that salvation for Israel would come out of Zion! When God restores the fortunes of his people, Let Jacob rejoice, let Israel be glad.

text: Psalms 53.6 Oh, that salvation for Israel would come out of Zion! When God restores the fortunes of his people, Let Jacob rejoice, let Israel be glad.
verse_text: Psalms 53.6 O that the saluation of Israel were come out of Sion! when God bringeth backe the captiuitie of his people, Iaakob shall reioyce, and Israel shall be glad.

text: TO THE CHOIRMASTER: WITH STRINGED INSTRUMENTS. A MASKIL OF DAVID, WHEN THE ZIPHITES WENT AND TOLD SAUL, "IS NOT DAVID HIDING AMONG US?" O God, save me, by your name, and vindicate me by your might.
verse_text: Psalms 54.1 To him that excelleth on Neginoth. A Psalme of David, to give instruction. When the Ziphims came and said unto Saul, Is not David hid among us? Save mee, O God, by thy Name, and by thy power iudge me.

text: Psalms 54.1 TO THE CHOIRMASTER: WITH STRINGED INSTRUMENTS. A MASKIL OF DAVID, WHEN THE ZIPHITES WENT AND TOLD SAUL, "IS NOT DAVID HIDING AMONG US?" O God, save me, by your name, and vindicate me by your might.
verse_text: Psalms 54.1 Saue me, O God, by thy name, and iudge me by thy strength.

text: For strangers have risen against me; ruthless men seek my life; they do not set God before themselves. Selah
verse_text: Psalms 54.3 For strangers are risen vp against me, and tyrants seeke my soule: they haue not set God before them. Selah.

text: Psalms 54.3 For strangers have risen against me; ruthless men seek my life; they do not set God before themselves. Selah
verse_text: Psalms 54.3 For strangers are risen vp against me, and oppressors seeke after my soule; they haue not set God before them. Selah.

text: With a freewill offering I will sacrifice to you; I will give thanks to your name, O LORD, for it is good.

text: because of the noise of the enemy, because of the oppression of the wicked. For they drop trouble upon me, and in anger they bear a grudge against me.

text: Psalms 55.17 Evening and morning and at noon I utter my complaint and moan, and he hears my voice.
verse_text: Psalms 55.17 Euening and morning, and at noone will I pray, and crie aloud: and he shall heare my voyce.

text: God will give ear and humble them, he who is enthroned from of old, Selah because they do not change and do not fear God.
verse_text: Psalms 55.19 God shall heare and afflict them, euen hee that reigneth of olde, Selah. because they haue no changes, therefore they feare not God.

text: Psalms 55.19 God will give ear and humble them, he who is enthroned from of old, Selah because they do not change and do not fear God.
verse_text: Psalms 55.19 God shall heare and afflict them, euen he that abideth of old, Selah: because they haue no changes, therefore they feare not God.

text: His speech was smooth as butter, yet war was in his heart; his words were softer than oil, yet they were drawn swords.
verse_text: Psalms 55.21 The wordes of his mouth were softer then butter, yet warre was in his heart: his words were more gentle then oyle, yet they were swordes.

text: Psalms 55.21 His speech was smooth as butter, yet war was in his heart; his words were softer than oil, yet they were drawn swords.
verse_text: Psalms 55.21 The words of his mouth were smoother then butter, but warre was in his heart: his words were softer then oyle, yet were they drawen swords.

text: Cast your burden on the LORD, and he will sustain you; he will never permit the righteous to bemoved.
verse_text: Psalms 55.22 Cast thy burden vpon the Lord, and hee shall nourish thee: he wil not suffer the righteous to fall for euer.

text: Psalms 55.22 Cast your burden on the LORD, and he will sustain you; he will never permit the righteous to bemoved.
verse_text: Psalms 55.22 Cast thy burden vpon the Lord, and he shall sustaine thee: hee shall neuer suffer the righteous to bee moued.

text: TO THE CHOIRMASTER: ACCORDING TO THE DOVE ON FAR-OFF TEREBINTHS. A MIKTAM OF DAVID, WHEN THE PHILISTINES SEIZED HIM IN GATH. Be gracious to me, O God, for man tramples on me; all day long an attacker oppresses me;
verse_text: Psalms 56.1 To him that excelleth. A Psalme of David on Michtam, concerning the dumme doue in a farre countrey, when the Philistims tooke him in Gath. Be mercifull vnto me, O God, for man would swallow me vp: he fighteth continually and vexeth me.

text: Psalms 56.1 TO THE CHOIRMASTER: ACCORDING TO THE DOVE ON FAR-OFF TEREBINTHS. A MIKTAM OF DAVID, WHEN THE PHILISTINES SEIZED HIM IN GATH. Be gracious to me, O God, for man tramples on me; all day long an attacker oppresses me;
verse_text: Psalms 56.1 Be mercifull vnto mee, O God, for man would swallow me vp: he fighting daily, oppresseth me.

text: For you have delivered my soul from death, yes, my feet from falling, that I may walk before God in the light of life.
verse_text: Psalms 55.13 quoniam eripuisti animam meam de morte, et pedes meos de lapsu, ut placeam coram Deo in lumine viventium.

text: Psalms 56.13 For you have delivered my soul from death, yes, my feet from falling, that I may walk before God in the light of life.
verse_text: Psalms 55.13 Because thou hast deliuered my soule from death, and my feete from falling: that I may please before God, in the light of the liuing.

text: Psalms 56.13 For you have delivered my soul from death, yes, my feet from falling, that I may walk before God in the light of life.
verse_text: Psalms 56.13 For thou hast deliuered my soule from death, and also my feete from falling, that I may walke before God in the light of the liuing.

text: TO THE CHOIRMASTER: ACCORDING TO DO NOT DESTROY. A MIKTAM OF DAVID, WHEN HE FLED FROM SAUL, IN THE CAVE. Be merciful to me, O God, be merciful to me, for in you my soul takes refuge; in the shadow of your wings I will take refuge, till the storms of destruction pass by.
verse_text: Psalms 57.1 To him that excelleth. Destroy not. A Psalme of David on Michtam. When he fled from Saul in the cave. Have mercie vpon me, O God, haue mercie vpon me: for my soule trusteth in thee, and in the shadowe of thy wings wil I trust, till these afflictions ouerpasse.

text: Psalms 57.1 TO THE CHOIRMASTER: ACCORDING TO DO NOT DESTROY. A MIKTAM OF DAVID, WHEN HE FLED FROM SAUL, IN THE CAVE. Be merciful to me, O God, be merciful to me, for in you my soul takes refuge; in the shadow of your wings I will take refuge, till the storms of destruction pass by.
verse_text: Psalms 57.1 Be mercifull vnto mee, O God, be merciful vnto me, for my soule trusteth in thee: yea in the shadow of thy wings will I make my refuge, vntill these calamities bee ouerpast.

text: He will send from heaven and save me; he will put to shame him who tramples on me. Selah God will send out his steadfast love and his faithfulness!
verse_text: Psalms 56.4 Misit de cælo, et liberavit me; dedit in opprobrium conculcantes me. Misit Deus misericordiam suam et veritatem suam,
label: True

text: Psalms 57.3 He will send from heaven and save me; he will put to shame him who tramples on me. Selah God will send out his steadfast love and his faithfulness!
verse_text: Psalms 56.4 He sent from heauen, and deliuered me: he hath geuen into reproche them that trode vpon me. God hath sent his mercie, and his truth,
label: True

text: Psalms 57.3 He will send from heaven and save me; he will put to shame him who tramples on me. Selah God will send out his steadfast love and his faithfulness!
verse_text: Psalms 57.3 He will send from heauen, and saue me from the reproofe of him that would swallowe me. Selah. God wil send his mercy, and his trueth.

text: Psalms 57.3 He will send from heaven and save me; he will put to shame him who tramples on me. Selah God will send out his steadfast love and his faithfulness!
verse_text: Psalms 57.3 Hee shall send from heauen, and saue me from the reproch of him, that would swallow me vp; Selah. God shall send forth his mercy and his trueth.

text: My soul is in the midst of lions; I lie down amid fiery beasts- the children of man, whose teeth are spears and arrows, whose tongues are sharp swords.
verse_text: Psalms 56.5 et eripuit animam meam de medio catulorum leonum. Dormivi conturbatus. Filii hominum dentes eorum arma et sagittæ, et lingua eorum gladius acutus.
label: True

text: Psalms 57.4 My soul is in the midst of lions; I lie down amid fiery beasts- the children of man, whose teeth are spears and arrows, whose tongues are sharp swords.
verse_text: Psalms 56.5 and hath deliuered my soule out of the middes of Lions whelpes: I slept trubled. The sonnes of men, their teeth are weapons and arrowes: and their tongue a sharpe sword.
label: True

text: Psalms 57.4 My soul is in the midst of lions; I lie down amid fiery beasts- the children of man, whose teeth are spears and arrows, whose tongues are sharp swords.
verse_text: Psalms 57.4 My soule is among lions: I lie among the children of men, that are set on fire: whose teeth are speares and arrowes, and their tongue a sharpe sworde.

text: Psalms 57.4 My soul is in the midst of lions; I lie down amid fiery beasts- the children of man, whose teeth are spears and arrows, whose tongues are sharp swords.
verse_text: Psalms 57.4 My soule is among lyons, and I lie euen among them that are set on fire: euen the sonnes of men, whose teeth are speares and arrowes, and their tongue a sharpe sword.

text: My heart is steadfast, O God, my heart is steadfast! I will sing and make melody!
verse_text: Psalms 56.8 Paratum cor meum, Deus, paratum cor meum; cantabo, et psalmum dicam.
label: True

text: Psalms 57.7 My heart is steadfast, O God, my heart is steadfast! I will sing and make melody!
verse_text: Psalms 56.8 My hart is readie o God, my hart is readie: I wil sing, and say a Psalme.
label: True

text: Psalms 57.7 My heart is steadfast, O God, my heart is steadfast! I will sing and make melody!
verse_text: Psalms 57.7 Mine heart is prepared, O God, mine heart is prepared: I will sing and giue prayse.

text: Psalms 57.7 My heart is steadfast, O God, my heart is steadfast! I will sing and make melody!
verse_text: Psalms 57.7 My heart is fixed, O God, my heart is fixed: I will sing, and giue praise.

text: Awake, my glory! Awake, O harp and lyre! I will awake the dawn!

text: Psalms 57.8 Awake, my glory! Awake, O harp and lyre! I will awake the dawn!
verse_text: Psalms 57.8 Awake my tongue, awake viole and harpe: I wil awake early.

text: Psalms 57.8 Awake, my glory! Awake, O harp and lyre! I will awake the dawn!

text: I will give thanks to you, O Lord, among the peoples; I will sing praises to you among the nations.

verse_text: Psalms 57.11 Be thou exalted, O God, aboue the heauens: let thy glory be aboue all the earth.

text: The wicked are estranged from the womb; they go astray from birth, speaking lies.

verse_text: Psalms 58.3 The wicked are estranged from the wombe, they goe astray as soone as they be borne, speaking lies.

text: Let them vanish like water that runs away; when he aims his arrows, let them be blunted.

label: True

text: Sooner than your pots can feel the heat of thorns, whether green or ablaze, may he sweep them away!
verse_text: Psalms 58.9 Before your pots can feele the thornes, he shall take them away as with a whirlewind, both liuing, and in his wrath.

text: Mankind will say, "Surely there is a reward for the righteous; surely there is a God who judges on earth."
verse_text: Psalms 57.12 Et dicet homo: Si utique est fructus justo, utique est Deus judicans eos in terra.
label: True

text: Psalms 58.11 Mankind will say, "Surely there is a reward for the righteous; surely there is a God who judges on earth."
verse_text: Psalms 57.12 And man shal say: If certes there be fruite to the iust: there is a God certes iudging them on the earth.
label: True

text: Psalms 58.11 Mankind will say, "Surely there is a reward for the righteous; surely there is a God who judges on earth."
verse_text: Psalms 58.11 And men shall say, Verily there is fruite for the righteous: doutlesse there is a God that iudgeth in the earth.

text: Psalms 58.11 Mankind will say, "Surely there is a reward for the righteous; surely there is a God who judges on earth."
verse_text: Psalms 58.11 So that a man shall say, Uerily there is a reward for the righteous: verily hee is a God that iudgeth in the earth.

text: For behold, they lie in wait for my life; fierce men stir up strife against me. For no transgression or sin of mine, O LORD,
verse_text: Psalms 59.3 For loe, they haue layd waite for my soule: the mightie men are gathered against me, not for mine offence, nor for my sinne, O Lord.

text: Psalms 59.3 For behold, they lie in wait for my life; fierce men stir up strife against me. For no transgression or sin of mine, O LORD,
verse_text: Psalms 59.3 For loe, they lye in waite for my soule; the mighty are gathered against me, not for my transgression, nor for my sinne, O Lord.

text: You, LORD God of hosts, are God of Israel. Rouse yourself to punish all the nations; spare none of those who treacherously plot evil. Selah
verse_text: Psalms 58.6 Exsurge in occursum meum, et vide: et tu, Domine Deus virtutum, Deus Israël, intende ad visitandas omnes gentes: non miserearis omnibus qui operantur iniquitatem.
label: True

text: Psalms 59.5 You, LORD God of hosts, are God of Israel. Rouse yourself to punish all the nations; spare none of those who treacherously plot evil. Selah
verse_text: Psalms 59.5 Euen thou, O Lord God of hostes, O God of Israel awake to visit all the heathen, and be not merciful vnto all that transgresse maliciously. Selah.

text: Psalms 59.5 You, LORD God of hosts, are God of Israel. Rouse yourself to punish all the nations; spare none of those who treacherously plot evil. Selah
verse_text: Psalms 59.5 Thou therefore, O Lord God of hostes, the God of Israel, awake to visite all the heathen: be not mercifull to any wicked transgressours. Selah.

text: O my Strength, I will watch for you, for you, O God, are my fortress.
verse_text: Psalms 58.10 Fortitudinem meam ad te custodiam, quia, Deus, susceptor meus es:
label: True

text: My God in his steadfast love will meet me; God will let me look in triumph on my enemies.
verse_text: Psalms 59.10 My mercifull God will preuent me: God wil let me see my desire vpon mine enemies.

text: Psalms 59.10 My God in his steadfast love will meet me; God will let me look in triumph on my enemies.
verse_text: Psalms 59.10 The God of my mercy shall preuent me; God shall let mee see my desire vpon mine enemies.

text: For the sin of their mouths, the words of their lips, let them be trapped in their pride. For the cursing and lies that they utter,

label: True

verse_text: Psalms 59.12 For the sinne of their mouth, and the words of their lips, let them euen be taken in their pride: and for cursing and lying which they speake.

text: consume them in wrath; consume them till they are no more, that they may know that God rules over Jacob to the ends of the earth. Selah

label: True

verse_text: Psalms 59.13 Consume them in wrath, consume them, that they may not be: and let them know that God ruleth in Iacob, vnto the ends of the earth. Selah.

text: Each evening they come back, howling like dogs and prowling about the city.

verse_text: Psalms 59.14 And at euening let them returne, and let them make a noise like a dogge, and goe round about the citie.

text: But I will sing of your strength; I will sing aloud of your steadfast love in the morning. For you have been to me a fortress and a refuge in the day of my distress.

label: True

text: Psalms 59.16 But I will sing of your strength; I will sing aloud of your steadfast love in the morning. For you have been to me a fortress and a refuge in the day of my distress.
verse_text: Psalms 58.17 But I wil sing thy strength: and wil exalt thy mercie in the morning. Because thou art become my receiuer, and my refuge, in the day of my tribulation. My helper, I wil sing to thee, because thou art God my receiuer: my God, my mercie.
label: True

text: Psalms 59.16 But I will sing of your strength; I will sing aloud of your steadfast love in the morning. For you have been to me a fortress and a refuge in the day of my distress.
verse_text: Psalms 59.16 But I wil sing of thy power, and will prayse thy mercy in the morning: for thou hast bene my defence and refuge in the day of my trouble.

verse_text: Psalms 59.16 But I will sing of thy power; yea I will sing alowd of thy mercy in the morning: for thou hast bene my defence and refuge, in the day of my trouble.

text: TO THE CHOIRMASTER: ACCORDING TO SHUSHAN EDUTH. A MIKTAM OF DAVID; FOR INSTRUCTION; WHEN HE STROVE WITH ARAM-NAHARAIM AND WITH ARAM-ZOBAH, AND WHEN JOAB ON HIS RETURN STRUCK DOWN TWELVE THOUSAND OF EDOM IN THE VALLEY OF SALT. O God, you have rejected us, broken our defenses; you have been angry; oh, restore us.
verse_text: Psalms 60.1 To him that excelleth upon Shushan Eduth, or Michtam. A Psalme of David to teach. When he fought against Aram Naharaim, and against Aram Zobah, when Joab returned and slew twelve thousand Edomites in the salt valley. O God, thou hast cast vs out, thou hast scattered vs, thou hast bene angry, turne againe vnto vs.

text: Psalms 60.1 TO THE CHOIRMASTER: ACCORDING TO SHUSHAN EDUTH. A MIKTAM OF DAVID; FOR INSTRUCTION; WHEN HE STROVE WITH ARAM-NAHARAIM AND WITH ARAM-ZOBAH, AND WHEN JOAB ON HIS RETURN STRUCK DOWN TWELVE THOUSAND OF EDOM IN THE VALLEY OF SALT. O God, you have rejected us, broken our defenses; you have been angry; oh, restore us.
verse_text: Psalms 60.1 O God, thou hast cast vs off; thou hast scattered vs, thou hast bene displeased, O turne thy selfe to vs againe.

text: You have set up a banner for those who fear you, that they may flee to it from the bow. Selah
verse_text: Psalms 60.4 But now thou hast giuen a banner to them that feare thee, that it may be displayed because of thy trueth. Selah.

text: That your beloved ones may be delivered, give salvation by your right hand and answer us!
verse_text: Psalms 60.5 That thy beloued may be deliuered, helpe with thy right hand and heare me.

text: Psalms 60.5 That your beloved ones may be delivered, give salvation by your right hand and answer us!
verse_text: Psalms 60.5 That thy beloued may be deliuered; saue with thy right hand, and heare mee.

text: God has spoken in his holiness: "With exultation I will divide up Shechem and portion out the Vale of Succoth.
verse_text: Psalms 60.6 God hath spoken in his holines: therefore I will reioyce: I shall deuide Shechem, and measure the valley of Succoth.

text: Psalms 60.6 God has spoken in his holiness: "With exultation I will divide up Shechem and portion out the Vale of Succoth.
verse_text: Psalms 60.6 God hath spoken in his holinesse, I wil reioyce: I will diuide Shechem, and mete out the valley of Succoth.

text: Who will bring me to the fortified city? Who will lead me to Edom?
verse_text: Psalms 60.9 Who will leade me into the strong citie? who will bring me vnto Edom?

text: Psalms 60.9 Who will bring me to the fortified city? Who will lead me to Edom?
verse_text: Psalms 60.9 Who wil bring me into the strong citie? who will lead me into Edom?

text: With God we shall do valiantly; it is he who will tread down our foes.
verse_text: Psalms 60.12 Through God we shall doe valiantly: for he shall tread downe our enemies.

text: O God, be not far from me; O my God, make haste to help me!

text: Psalms 71.12 O God, be not far from me; O my God, make haste to help me!

text: Psalms 71.12 O God, be not far from me; O my God, make haste to help me!

text: May my accusers be put to shame and consumed; with scorn and disgrace may they be covered who seek my hurt.

text: Psalms 71.13 May my accusers be put to shame and consumed; with scorn and disgrace may they be covered who seek my hurt.
verse_text: Psalms 70.13 Let them be confounded, and fayle that detract from my soule: let them be couered with confusion, and shame, that seeke euils to me.

text: Psalms 71.13 May my accusers be put to shame and consumed; with scorn and disgrace may they be covered who seek my hurt.
verse_text: Psalms 71.13 Let them be confounded and consumed that are against my soule: let them be couered with reproofe and confusion, that seeke mine hurt.

text: Psalms 71.13 May my accusers be put to shame and consumed; with scorn and disgrace may they be covered who seek my hurt.
verse_text: Psalms 71.13 Let them be confounded and consumed, that are aduersaries to my soule: let them bee couered with reproch and dishonour, that seeke my hurt.

text: So even to old age and gray hairs, O God, do not forsake me, until I proclaim your might to another generation, your power to all those to come.

text: Psalms 71.18 So even to old age and gray hairs, O God, do not forsake me, until I proclaim your might to another generation, your power to all those to come.
verse_text: Psalms 70.18 And vnto ancient age, and old age: o God forsake me not? Vntil I shew forth thy arme to al the generation, that is to come. Thy might,

text: Psalms 71.18 So even to old age and gray hairs, O God, do not forsake me, until I proclaim your might to another generation, your power to all those to come.
verse_text: Psalms 71.18 Yea, euen vnto mine olde age and graie head, O God: forsake me not, vntill I haue declared thine arme vnto this generation, and thy power to all them, that shall come.

text: Psalms 71.18 So even to old age and gray hairs, O God, do not forsake me, until I proclaim your might to another generation, your power to all those to come.
verse_text: Psalms 71.18 Now also when I am old and gray headed, O God, forsake me not: vntill I haue shewed thy strength vnto this generation, and thy power to euery one that is to come.

text: May he defend the cause of the poor of the people, give deliverance to the children of the needy, and crush the oppressor!

text: Long may he live; may gold of Sheba be given to him! May prayer be made for him continually, and blessings invoked for him all the day!

text: May his name endure forever, his fame continue as long as the sun! May people be blessed in him,all nations call him blessed!

text: Psalms 72.17 May his name endure forever, his fame continue as long as the sun! May people be blessed in him,all nations call him blessed!

text: For they have no pangs until death; their bodies are fat and sleek.

text: Psalms 86.13 For great is your steadfast love toward me; you have delivered my soul from the depths of Sheol.
verse_text: Psalms 86.13 For great is thy mercy toward me: and thou hast deliuered my soule from the lowest hell.

text: O God, insolent men have risen up against me; a band of ruthless men seek my life, and they do not set you before them.
verse_text: Psalms 85.14 Deus, iniqui insurrexerunt super me, et synagoga potentium quæsierunt animam meam: et non proposuerunt te in conspectu suo.

text: Psalms 86.14 O God, insolent men have risen up against me; a band of ruthless men seek my life, and they do not set you before them.
verse_text: Psalms 85.14 O God the wicked are risen vp vpon me, and the synagogue of the mightie haue sought my soule: and they haue not set thee in their sight.

text: Psalms 86.14 O God, insolent men have risen up against me; a band of ruthless men seek my life, and they do not set you before them.
verse_text: Psalms 86.14 O God, the proude are risen against me, and the assemblies of violent men haue sought my soule, and haue not set thee before them.

text: Psalms 86.14 O God, insolent men have risen up against me; a band of ruthless men seek my life, and they do not set you before them.
verse_text: Psalms 86.14 O God, the proud are risen against mee, and the assemblies of violent men haue sought after my soule: and haue not set thee before them.

text: But you, O Lord, are a God merciful and gracious, slow to anger and abounding in steadfast love and faithfulness.
verse_text: Psalms 85.15 Et tu, Domine Deus, miserator et misericors; patiens, et multæ misericordiæ, et verax.

text: Psalms 86.15 But you, O Lord, are a God merciful and gracious, slow to anger and abounding in steadfast love and faithfulness.
verse_text: Psalms 85.15 And thou o Lord the God of compassion and merciful, patient, and of much mercie, and true.

text: Psalms 86.15 But you, O Lord, are a God merciful and gracious, slow to anger and abounding in steadfast love and faithfulness.
verse_text: Psalms 86.15 But thou, O Lord, art a pitifull God and mercifull, slowe to anger and great in kindenes and trueth.

text: Psalms 86.15 But you, O Lord, are a God merciful and gracious, slow to anger and abounding in steadfast love and faithfulness.
verse_text: Psalms 86.15 But thou, O Lord, art a God full of compassion, and gracious: long suffering, and plenteous in mercy and trueth.

text: Turn to me and be gracious to me; give your strength to your servant, and save the son of your maidservant.
verse_text: Psalms 85.16 Respice in me, et miserere mei; da imperium tuum puero tuo, et salvum fac filium ancillæ tuæ.

text: Psalms 86.16 Turn to me and be gracious to me; give your strength to your servant, and save the son of your maidservant.
verse_text: Psalms 85.16 Haue respect to me, and haue mercie on me, giue thine empire to thy seruant: and saue the sonne of thy handmaide.

text: Psalms 86.16 Turn to me and be gracious to me; give your strength to your servant, and save the son of your maidservant.
verse_text: Psalms 86.16 Turne vnto me, and haue mercy vpon me: giue thy strength vnto thy seruant, and saue the sonne of thine handmayd.

text: Psalms 86.16 Turn to me and be gracious to me; give your strength to your servant, and save the son of your maidservant.
verse_text: Psalms 86.16 O turne vnto me, and haue mercie vpon me, giue thy strength vnto thy seruant: and saue the sonne of thine handmaid.

text: For my soul is full of troubles, and my life draws near to Sheol.

text: Psalms 88.3 For my soul is full of troubles, and my life draws near to Sheol.

text: You have put me in the depths of the pit, in the regions dark and deep.

text: You have caused my companions to shun me; you have made me a horror to them. I am shut in so that I cannot escape;

label: True

text: Psalms 88.8 You have caused my companions to shun me; you have made me a horror to them. I am shut in so that I cannot escape;

text: Psalms 88.8 You have caused my companions to shun me; you have made me a horror to them. I am shut in so that I cannot escape;
verse_text: Psalms 88.8 Thou hast put away mine acquaintance farre from mee: thou hast made me an abomination vnto them: I am shut vp, and I cannot come forth.

text: Are your wonders known in the darkness, or your righteousness in the land of forgetfulness?

text: They surround me like a flood all day long; they close in on me together.

text: Let the heavens praise your wonders, O LORD, your faithfulness in the assembly of the holy ones!

text: Psalms 89.5 Let the heavens praise your wonders, O LORD, your faithfulness in the assembly of the holy ones!

verse_text: Psalms 89.50 Remember (Lord) the reproach of thy seruants: how I doe beare in my bosome the reproache of all the mighty people.

text: A PRAYER OF MOSES, THE MAN OF GOD. Lord, you have been our dwelling place in all generations.

text: The years of our life are seventy, or even by reason of strength eighty; yet their span is but toil and trouble; they are soon gone, and we fly away.
verse_text: Psalms 89.10 dies annorum nostrorum in ipsis septuaginta anni. Si autem in potentatibus octoginta anni, et amplius eorum labor et dolor; quoniam supervenit mansuetudo, et corripiemur.

text: Psalms 90.10 The years of our life are seventy, or even by reason of strength eighty; yet their span is but toil and trouble; they are soon gone, and we fly away.
verse_text: Psalms 89.10 the daies of our yeares in them, are seuentie yeares. And if in strong ones eightie years: and the more of them, labour and sorrow. Because mildnes is come vpon vs: and we shal be chastised.

text: Psalms 90.10 The years of our life are seventy, or even by reason of strength eighty; yet their span is but toil and trouble; they are soon gone, and we fly away.
verse_text: Psalms 90.10 The time of our life is threescore yeeres and ten, and if they be of strength, fourescore yeeres: yet their strength is but labour and sorowe: for it is cut off quickly, and we flee away.

text: Psalms 90.10 The years of our life are seventy, or even by reason of strength eighty; yet their span is but toil and trouble; they are soon gone, and we fly away.
verse_text: Psalms 90.10 The dayes of our yeres are threescore yeeres and ten, and if by reason of strength they be fourescore yeeres, yet is their strength labour and sorrow: for it is soone cut off, and we flie away.

text: Make us glad for as many days as you have afflicted us, and for as many years as we have seen evil.
verse_text: Psalms 89.15 Lætati sumus pro diebus quibus nos humiliasti; annis quibus vidimus mala.

text: Psalms 90.15 Make us glad for as many days as you have afflicted us, and for as many years as we have seen evil.
verse_text: Psalms 89.15 We haue reioyced for the daies wherin thou hast humbled vs: the yeares, wherin we haue seene euils.

text: Psalms 90.15 Make us glad for as many days as you have afflicted us, and for as many years as we have seen evil.
verse_text: Psalms 90.15 Comfort vs according to the dayes that thou hast afflicted vs, and according to the yeeres that we haue seene euill.

text: Psalms 90.15 Make us glad for as many days as you have afflicted us, and for as many years as we have seen evil.
verse_text: Psalms 90.15 Make vs glad according to the dayes wherein thou hast afflicted vs: and the yeeres wherein we haue seene euil.

text: Let your work be shown to your servants, and your glorious power to their children.
verse_text: Psalms 90.16 Let thy worke bee seene towarde thy seruants, and thy glory vpon their children.

text: Psalms 90.16 Let your work be shown to your servants, and your glorious power to their children.
verse_text: Psalms 90.16 Let thy worke appeare vnto thy seruants: and thy glory vnto their children.

text: Let the favor of the Lord our God be upon us, and establish the work of our hands upon us; yes, establish the work of our hands!
verse_text: Psalms 89.17 Et sit splendor Domini Dei nostri super nos, et opera manuum nostrarum dirige super nos, et opus manuum nostrarum dirige.

text: Psalms 90.17 Let the favor of the Lord our God be upon us, and establish the work of our hands upon us; yes, establish the work of our hands!
verse_text: Psalms 89.17 And let the brightnes of our Lord God be vpon vs, and direct thou the workes of our handes ouer vs: and the worke of our handes doe thou direct.

text: Psalms 90.17 Let the favor of the Lord our God be upon us, and establish the work of our hands upon us; yes, establish the work of our hands!
verse_text: Psalms 90.17 And let the beautie of the Lord our God be vpon vs, and direct thou the worke of our hands vpon vs, euen direct the worke of our handes.

text: Psalms 90.17 Let the favor of the Lord our God be upon us, and establish the work of our hands upon us; yes, establish the work of our hands!
verse_text: Psalms 90.17 And let the beautie of the Lord our God be vpon vs, and establish thou the worke of our hands vpon vs: yea, the work of our hands establish thou it.

text: I will say to the LORD, "My refuge and my fortress, my God, in whom I trust."
verse_text: Psalms 90.2 Dicet Domino: Susceptor meus es tu, et refugium meum; Deus meus, sperabo in eum.

text: Psalms 91.2 I will say to the LORD, "My refuge and my fortress, my God, in whom I trust."
verse_text: Psalms 90.2 He shal say to our Lord: Thou art my protectour, and my refuge: my God I wil hope in him.

text: Psalms 91.2 I will say to the LORD, "My refuge and my fortress, my God, in whom I trust."
verse_text: Psalms 91.2 I will say vnto the Lord, O mine hope, and my fortresse: he is my God, in him will I trust.

text: Psalms 91.2 I will say to the LORD, "My refuge and my fortress, my God, in whom I trust."
verse_text: Psalms 91.2 I will say of the Lord, He is my refuge, and my fortresse: my God, in him will I trust.

text: You will not fear the terror of the night, nor the arrow that flies by day,

label: True

verse_text: Psalms 91.5 Thou shalt not be afraide of the feare of the night, nor of the arrowe that flyeth by day:

text: Psalms 91.5 You will not fear the terror of the night, nor the arrow that flies by day,
verse_text: Psalms 91.5 Thou shalt not bee afraid for the terrour by night: nor for the arrow that flieth by day:

text: A thousand may fall at your side, ten thousand at your right hand, but it will not come near you.
verse_text: Psalms 90.7 Cadent a latere tuo mille, et decem millia a dextris tuis; ad te autem non appropinquabit.

text: Psalms 91.7 A thousand may fall at your side, ten thousand at your right hand, but it will not come near you.

verse_text: Psalms 91.7 A thousand shall fall at thy side, and ten thousand at thy right hand: but it shall not come nigh thee.

text: For he will command his angels concerning you to guard you in all your ways.

text: Psalms 91.11 For he will command his angels concerning you to guard you in all your ways.
verse_text: Psalms 90.11 Because he hath geuen his Angels charge of thee: that they keepe thee in al thy waies.

verse_text: Psalms 91.11 For hee shall giue his Angels charge ouer thee to keepe thee in all thy wayes.

verse_text: Psalms 91.11 For hee shall giue his Angels charge ouer thee: to keepe thee in all thy wayes.

text: On their hands they will bear you up, lest you strike your foot against a stone.
verse_text: Psalms 90.12 In manibus portabunt te, ne forte offendas ad lapidem pedem tuum.

text: Psalms 91.12 On their hands they will bear you up, lest you strike your foot against a stone.

verse_text: Psalms 91.12 They shall beare thee vp in their hands: lest thou dash thy foot against a stone.

text: You will tread on the lion and the adder; the young lion and the serpent you will trample underfoot.

text: Psalms 91.13 You will tread on the lion and the adder; the young lion and the serpent you will trample underfoot.
verse_text: Psalms 90.13 Vpon the aspe, as the basiliscus thou shalt walke: & thou shalt tread vpon the lion, and the dragon.

text: Psalms 91.13 You will tread on the lion and the adder; the young lion and the serpent you will trample underfoot.
verse_text: Psalms 91.13 Thou shalt walke vpon the lyon and aspe: the yong lyon and the dragon shalt thou treade vnder feete.

text: Psalms 91.13 You will tread on the lion and the adder; the young lion and the serpent you will trample underfoot.
verse_text: Psalms 91.13 Thou shalt tread vpon the Lion, and adder: the yong Lion and the dragon shalt thou trample vnder feete.

text: "Because he holds fast to me in love, I will deliver him; I will protect him, because he knows myname.
verse_text: Psalms 90.14 Quoniam in me speravit, liberabo eum; protegam eum, quoniam cognovit nomen meum.

text: Psalms 91.14 "Because he holds fast to me in love, I will deliver him; I will protect him, because he knows myname.
verse_text: Psalms 90.14 Because he hath hoped in me, I wil deliuer him: I wil protect him, because he hath knowne my name.

text: Psalms 91.14 "Because he holds fast to me in love, I will deliver him; I will protect him, because he knows myname.
verse_text: Psalms 91.14 Because he hath loued me, therefore will I deliuer him: I will exalt him because hee hath knowen my Name.

text: Psalms 91.14 "Because he holds fast to me in love, I will deliver him; I will protect him, because he knows myname.
verse_text: Psalms 91.14 Because he hath set his loue vpon me, therefore will I deliuer him: I wil set him on high, because hee hath knowen my Name.

text: When he calls to me, I will answer him; I will be with him in trouble; I will rescue him and honor him.
verse_text: Psalms 90.15 Clamabit ad me, et ego exaudiam eum; cum ipso sum in tribulatione: eripiam eum, et glorificabo eum.

text: Psalms 91.15 When he calls to me, I will answer him; I will be with him in trouble; I will rescue him and honor him.
verse_text: Psalms 90.15 He shal crie to me, and I wil heare him: with him I am in tribulation: I wil deliuer him, and wil glorifie him.

text: Psalms 91.15 When he calls to me, I will answer him; I will be with him in trouble; I will rescue him and honor him.

text: With long life I will satisfy him and show him my salvation."

text: Mightier than the thunders of many waters, mightier than the waves of the sea, the LORD on high is mighty!

text: Do not hide your face from me in the day of my distress! Incline your ear to me; answer me speedily in the day when I call!
verse_text: Psalms 101.3 Non avertas faciem tuam a me: in quacumque die tribulor, inclina ad me aurem tuam; in quacumque die invocavero te, velociter exaudi me.
label: True

text: Psalms 102.2 Do not hide your face from me in the day of my distress! Incline your ear to me; answer me speedily in the day when I call!

text: Proverbs 28.4 Those who forsake the law praise the wicked, but those who keep the law strive against them.
verse_text: Proverbs 28.4 Qui derelinquunt legem laudant impium; qui custodiunt, succenduntur contra eum.

text: Proverbs 28.4 Those who forsake the law praise the wicked, but those who keep the law strive against them.
verse_text: Proverbs 28.4 They that forsake the Law, prayse the wicked: but they that keepe the Law, set themselues against them.

text: Proverbs 28.4 Those who forsake the law praise the wicked, but those who keep the law strive against them.
verse_text: Proverbs 28.4 They that forsake the law, praise the wicked: but such as keepe the Law, contend with them.

text: Whoever misleads the upright into an evil way will fall into his own pit, but the blameless will have a goodly inheritance.
verse_text: Proverbs 28.10 He that deceiveth the just in a wicked way, shall fall in his own destruction: and the upright shall possess his goods.

text: Proverbs 28.10 Whoever misleads the upright into an evil way will fall into his own pit, but the blameless will have a goodly inheritance.
verse_text: Proverbs 28.10 Qui decipit justos in via mala, in interitu suo corruet, et simplices possidebunt bona ejus.

text: Proverbs 28.10 Whoever misleads the upright into an evil way will fall into his own pit, but the blameless will have a goodly inheritance.
verse_text: Proverbs 28.10 He that causeth the righteous to go astray by an euill way, shall fall into his owne pit, and the vpright shall inherite good things.

text: Proverbs 28.10 Whoever misleads the upright into an evil way will fall into his own pit, but the blameless will have a goodly inheritance.
verse_text: Proverbs 28.10 Who so causeth the righteous to goe astray in an euill way, he shall fall himselfe into his owne pit: but the vpright shall haue good things in possession.

text: Like a roaring lion or a charging bear is a wicked ruler over a poor people.
verse_text: Proverbs 28.15 As a roaring lion, and a hungry bear, so is a wicked prince over the poor people.

text: Proverbs 28.15 Like a roaring lion or a charging bear is a wicked ruler over a poor people.
verse_text: Proverbs 28.15 Leo rugiens et ursus esuriens, princeps impius super populum pauperem.

text: Proverbs 28.15 Like a roaring lion or a charging bear is a wicked ruler over a poor people.
verse_text: Proverbs 28.15 As a roaring lyon, and an hungry beare, so is a wicked ruler ouer the poore people.

text: Proverbs 28.15 Like a roaring lion or a charging bear is a wicked ruler over a poor people.
verse_text: Proverbs 28.15 As a roaring lyon and a ranging beare: so is a wicked ruler ouer the poore people.

text: The partner of a thief hates his own life; he hears the curse, but discloses nothing.
verse_text: Proverbs 29.24 He that is partaker with a thief, hateth his own soul: he heareth one putting him to his oath, and discovereth not.

text: Proverbs 29.24 The partner of a thief hates his own life; he hears the curse, but discloses nothing.
verse_text: Proverbs 29.24 Qui cum fure participat odit animam suam; adjurantem audit, et non indicat.

text: Proverbs 29.24 The partner of a thief hates his own life; he hears the curse, but discloses nothing.
verse_text: Proverbs 29.24 He that is partner with a thiefe, hateth his owne soule: he heareth cursing, and declareth it not.

text: Proverbs 29.24 The partner of a thief hates his own life; he hears the curse, but discloses nothing.
verse_text: Proverbs 29.24 Who so is partner with a thiefe, hateth his owne soule: hee heareth cursing, and bewrayeth it not.

text: And whatever my eyes desired I did not keep from them. I kept my heart from no pleasure, for my heart found pleasure in all my toil, and this was my reward for all my toil.
verse_text: Ecclesiastes 2.10 And whatsoever my eyes desired, I refused them not: and I withheld not my heart from enjoying every pleasure, and delighting itself in the things which I had prepared: and esteemed this my portion, to make use of my own labour.

text: Ecclesiastes 2.10 And whatever my eyes desired I did not keep from them. I kept my heart from no pleasure, for my heart found pleasure in all my toil, and this was my reward for all my toil.
verse_text: Ecclesiastes 2.10 Et omnia quæ desideraverunt oculi mei non negavi eis, nec prohibui cor meum quin omni voluptate frueretur, et oblectaret se in his quæ præparaveram; et hanc ratus sum partem meam si uterer labore meo.

text: Ecclesiastes 2.10 And whatever my eyes desired I did not keep from them. I kept my heart from no pleasure, for my heart found pleasure in all my toil, and this was my reward for all my toil.
verse_text: Ecclesiastes 2.10 And whatsoeuer mine eyes desired, I withheld it not from them: I withdrew not mine heart from any ioy: for mine heart reioyced in al my labour: and this was my portion of all my trauaile.

text: Ecclesiastes 2.10 And whatever my eyes desired I did not keep from them. I kept my heart from no pleasure, for my heart found pleasure in all my toil, and this was my reward for all my toil.
verse_text: Ecclesiastes 2.10 And whatsoeuer mine eyes desired, I kept not from them; I withheld not my heart from any ioy: for my heart reioyced in all my labour; and this was my portion of all my labour.

text: So I turned to consider wisdom and madness and folly. For what can the man do who comes after the king? Only what has already been done.
verse_text: Ecclesiastes 2.12 Transivi ad contemplandam sapientiam, erroresque, et stultitiam. (Quid est, inquam, homo, ut sequi possit regem, factorem suum?)

text: Ecclesiastes 2.12 So I turned to consider wisdom and madness and folly. For what can the man do who comes after the king? Only what has already been done.
verse_text: Ecclesiastes 2.12 And I turned to beholde wisedome, and madnes and follie: (for who is the man that will come after the King in things, which men nowe haue done?)

text: Ecclesiastes 2.12 So I turned to consider wisdom and madness and folly. For what can the man do who comes after the king? Only what has already been done.
verse_text: Ecclesiastes 2.12 And I turned my selfe to behold wisedome, and madnesse and folly: for what can the man doe, that commeth after the king? euen that which hath bene already done.

text: Again, I saw vanity under the sun:
verse_text: Ecclesiastes 4.7 Considering I found also another vanity under the sun:

text: Ecclesiastes 4.7 Again, I saw vanity under the sun:
verse_text: Ecclesiastes 4.7 Considerans, reperi et aliam vanitatem sub sole.

text: Ecclesiastes 4.7 Again, I saw vanity under the sun:
verse_text: Ecclesiastes 4.7 Againe I returned, and sawe vanitie vnder the sunne.

text: Ecclesiastes 4.7 Again, I saw vanity under the sun:
verse_text: Ecclesiastes 4.7 Then I returned, and I saw vanitie vnder the Sunne.

text: Everyone also to whom God has given wealth and possessions and power to enjoy them, and to accept his lot and rejoice in his toil- this is the gift of God.
verse_text: Ecclesiastes 5.19 Euery man also to whom God hath giuen riches and wealth, and hath giuen him power to eate thereof, and to take his portion, and to reioyce in his labour; this is the gift of God.

text: The more words, the more vanity, and what is the advantage to man?
verse_text: Ecclesiastes 6.11 There are many words that have much vanity in disputing.

text: Ecclesiastes 6.11 The more words, the more vanity, and what is the advantage to man?
verse_text: Ecclesiastes 6.11 Seeing there be many things that increase vanitie, what is man the better?

text: It is good that you should take hold of this, and from that withhold not your hand, for the one who fears God shall come out from both of them.
verse_text: Ecclesiastes 7.18 It is good that thou shouldest take holde of this, yea also from this withdraw not thine hand: for hee that feareth God, shall come foorth of them all.

text: Because the sentence against an evil deed is not executed speedily, the heart of the children of man is fully set to do evil.
verse_text: Ecclesiastes 8.11 For because sentence is not speedily pronounced against the evil, the children of men commit evils without any fear.

text: Ecclesiastes 8.11 Because the sentence against an evil deed is not executed speedily, the heart of the children of man is fully set to do evil.
verse_text: Ecclesiastes 8.11 Etenim quia non profertur cito contra malos sententia, absque timore ullo filii hominum perpetrant mala.

text: Ecclesiastes 8.11 Because the sentence against an evil deed is not executed speedily, the heart of the children of man is fully set to do evil.
verse_text: Ecclesiastes 8.11 Because sentence against an euill worke is not executed speedily, therefore the heart of the children of men is fully set in them to doe euill.

text: Ecclesiastes 8.11 Because the sentence against an evil deed is not executed speedily, the heart of the children of man is fully set to do evil.
verse_text: Ecclesiastes 8.11 Because sentence against an euill worke is not executed speedily; therefore the heart of the sonnes of men is fully set in them to doe euill.

text: But all this I laid to heart, examining it all, how the righteous and the wise and their deeds are in the hand of God. Whether it is love or hate, man does not know; both are before him.
verse_text: Ecclesiastes 9.1 All these things have I considered in my heart, that I might carefully understand them: there are just men and wise men, and their works are in the hand of God: and yet man knoweth not whether he be worthy of love, or hatred:

text: Ecclesiastes 9.1 But all this I laid to heart, examining it all, how the righteous and the wise and their deeds are in the hand of God. Whether it is love or hate, man does not know; both are before him.
verse_text: Ecclesiastes 9.1 Omnia hæc tractavi in corde meo, ut curiose intelligerem. Sunt justi atque sapientes, et opera eorum in manu Dei; et tamen nescit homo utrum amore an odio dignus sit.

text: Ecclesiastes 9.1 But all this I laid to heart, examining it all, how the righteous and the wise and their deeds are in the hand of God. Whether it is love or hate, man does not know; both are before him.
verse_text: Ecclesiastes 9.1 I have surely giuen mine heart to all this, and to declare all this, that the iust, and the wise, and their workes are in the hand of God: and no man knoweth eyther loue or hatred of all that is before them.

text: Ecclesiastes 9.1 But all this I laid to heart, examining it all, how the righteous and the wise and their deeds are in the hand of God. Whether it is love or hate, man does not know; both are before him.
verse_text: Ecclesiastes 9.1 For all this I considered in my heart, euen to declare all this, that the righteous, and the wise, and their workes, are in the hand of God: no man knoweth either loue, or hatred, by all that is before them.

text: Wisdom is better than weapons of war, but one sinner destroys much good.
verse_text: Ecclesiastes 9.18 Better is wisdom, than weapons of war: and he that shall offend in one, shall lose many good things.

text: Ecclesiastes 9.18 Wisdom is better than weapons of war, but one sinner destroys much good.
verse_text: Ecclesiastes 9.18 Melior est sapientia quam arma bellica; et qui in uno peccaverit, multa bona perdet.

text: Ecclesiastes 9.18 Wisdom is better than weapons of war, but one sinner destroys much good.
verse_text: Ecclesiastes 9.18 Better is wisedome then weapons of warre: but one sinner destroyeth much good.

text: Ecclesiastes 9.18 Wisdom is better than weapons of war, but one sinner destroys much good.

text: The Song of Songs, which is Solomon's.
verse_text: Canticles 1.1 The song of songs, which is Solomons.

text: I compare you, my love, to a mare among Pharaoh's chariots.
verse_text: Canticles 1.9 I haue compared thee, O my loue, to a company of horses in Pharaohs chariots.

text: On my bed by nightI sought him whom my soul loves; I sought him, but found him not.

text: Canticles 3.1 On my bed by nightI sought him whom my soul loves; I sought him, but found him not.

text: Canticles 3.1 On my bed by nightI sought him whom my soul loves; I sought him, but found him not.
verse_text: Canticles 3.1 By night on my bed I sought him whome my soule loueth. I sought him, but I found him not.

text: Come with me from Lebanon, my bride; come with me from Lebanon. Depart from the peak of Amana, from the peak of Senir and Hermon, from the dens of lions, from the mountains of leopards.
verse_text: Canticles 4.8 Come from Libanus, my spouse, come from Libanus, come: thou shalt be crowned from the top of Amana, from the top of Sanir and Hermon, from the dens of the lions, from the mountains of the leopards.

text: Canticles 4.8 Come with me from Lebanon, my bride; come with me from Lebanon. Depart from the peak of Amana, from the peak of Senir and Hermon, from the dens of lions, from the mountains of leopards.
verse_text: Canticles 4.8 Veni de Libano, sponsa mea: veni de Libano, veni, coronaberis: de capite Amana, de vertice Sanir et Hermon, de cubilibus leonum, de montibus pardorum.

text: Canticles 4.8 Come with me from Lebanon, my bride; come with me from Lebanon. Depart from the peak of Amana, from the peak of Senir and Hermon, from the dens of lions, from the mountains of leopards.
verse_text: Canticles 4.8 Come with me from Lebanon, my spouse, euen with me from Lebanon, and looke from the toppe of Amanah, from the toppe of Shenir and Hermon, from the dennes of the lyons, and from the mountaines of the leopards.

text: Canticles 4.8 Come with me from Lebanon, my bride; come with me from Lebanon. Depart from the peak of Amana, from the peak of Senir and Hermon, from the dens of lions, from the mountains of leopards.
verse_text: Canticles 4.8 Come with me from Lebanon (my spouse,) with me from Lebanon: looke from the top of Amana, from the top of Shenir and Hermon, from the Lions dennes, from the mountaines of the Leopards.

text: His legs are alabaster columns, set on bases of gold. His appearance is like Lebanon, choice as the cedars.

text: Canticles 5.15 His legs are alabaster columns, set on bases of gold. His appearance is like Lebanon, choice as the cedars.

text: Where has your beloved gone,O most beautiful among women? Where has your beloved turned, that we may seek him with you?
verse_text: Canticles 6.1 Whither is thy beloued gone? O thou fairest among women, whither is thy beloued turned aside? that we may seeke him with thee.

text: Isaiah 2.9 So man is humbled, and each one is brought low- do not forgive them!

text: And though a tenth remain in it, it will be burned again, like a terebinth or an oak, whose stump remainswhen it is felled." The holy seed is its stump.
verse_text: Isaiah 6.13 And there shall be still a tithing therein, and she shall turn, and shall be made a show as a turpentine tree, and as an oak that spreadeth its branches: that which shall stand therein, shall be a holy seed.

text: Isaiah 6.13 And though a tenth remain in it, it will be burned again, like a terebinth or an oak, whose stump remainswhen it is felled." The holy seed is its stump.
verse_text: Isaiah 6.13 Et adhuc in ea decimatio, et convertetur, et erit in ostensionem sicut terebinthus, et sicut quercus quæ expandit ramos suos; semen sanctum erit id quod steterit in ea.

text: Isaiah 6.13 And though a tenth remain in it, it will be burned again, like a terebinth or an oak, whose stump remainswhen it is felled." The holy seed is its stump.
verse_text: Isaiah 6.13 But yet in it shalbe a tenth, and shall returne, and shalbe eaten vp as an elme or an oke, which haue a substance in them, when they cast their leaues: so the holy seede shall be the substance thereof.

text: Isaiah 6.13 And though a tenth remain in it, it will be burned again, like a terebinth or an oak, whose stump remainswhen it is felled." The holy seed is its stump.
verse_text: Isaiah 6.13 But yet in it shalbe a tenth, and it shall returne, and shall be eaten: as a Teyle tree, and as an Oke whose substance is in them, when they cast their leaues: so the holy seede shall be the substance thereof.

text: When the house of David was told, "Syria is in league with Ephraim," the heart of Ahaz and the heart of his people shook as the trees of the forest shake before the wind.
verse_text: Isaiah 7.2 And they told the house of David, saying: Syria hath rested upon Ephraim, and his heart was moved, and the heart of his people, as the trees of the woods are moved with the wind.

text: Isaiah 7.2 When the house of David was told, "Syria is in league with Ephraim," the heart of Ahaz and the heart of his people shook as the trees of the forest shake before the wind.
verse_text: Isaiah 7.2 debellare eam. Et nuntiaverunt domui David, dicentes: Requievit Syria super Ephraim. Et commotum est cor ejus, et cor populi ejus, sicut moventur ligna silvarum a facie venti.

text: Isaiah 7.2 When the house of David was told, "Syria is in league with Ephraim," the heart of Ahaz and the heart of his people shook as the trees of the forest shake before the wind.
verse_text: Isaiah 7.2 And it was tolde the house of Dauid, saying, Aram is ioyned with Ephraim: therefore his heart was moued, and the heart of his people, as the trees of the forest are moued by the winde.

text: Isaiah 7.2 When the house of David was told, "Syria is in league with Ephraim," the heart of Ahaz and the heart of his people shook as the trees of the forest shake before the wind.
verse_text: Isaiah 7.2 And it was told the house of Dauid, saying, Syria is confederate with Ephraim: and his heart was moued, and the heart of his people as the trees of the wood are mooued with the wind.

text: The LORD will bring upon you and upon your people and upon your father's house such days as have not come since the day that Ephraim departed from Judah- the king of Assyria."

text: Isaiah 7.17 The LORD will bring upon you and upon your people and upon your father's house such days as have not come since the day that Ephraim departed from Judah- the king of Assyria."

text: Isaiah 7.17 The LORD will bring upon you and upon your people and upon your father's house such days as have not come since the day that Ephraim departed from Judah- the king of Assyria."

text: "Do not call conspiracy all that this people calls conspiracy, and do not fear what they fear, nor be in dread.
verse_text: Isaiah 8.12 Say ye not: A conspiracy: for all that this people speaketh, is a conspiracy: neither fear ye their fear, nor be afraid.

text: Isaiah 8.12 "Do not call conspiracy all that this people calls conspiracy, and do not fear what they fear, nor be in dread.
verse_text: Isaiah 8.12 Non dicatis: Conjuratio; omnia enim quæ loquitur populus iste, conjuratio est: et timorem ejus ne timeatis, neque paveatis.

text: Isaiah 8.12 "Do not call conspiracy all that this people calls conspiracy, and do not fear what they fear, nor be in dread.
verse_text: Isaiah 8.12 Say ye not, A confederacie to all them, to whome this people sayth a confederacie, neither feare you their feare, nor be afrayd of them.

text: Isaiah 8.12 "Do not call conspiracy all that this people calls conspiracy, and do not fear what they fear, nor be in dread.
verse_text: Isaiah 8.12 Say ye not, A confederacie to all them, to whom this people shall say, A confederacie; neither feare yee their feare, nor be afraid.

text: The Lord has sent a word against Jacob, and it will fall on Israel;

text: Isaiah 9.8 The Lord has sent a word against Jacob, and it will fall on Israel;
verse_text: Isaiah 9.8 Verbum misit Dominus in Jacob, et cecidit in Israël.

text: Isaiah 9.8 The Lord has sent a word against Jacob, and it will fall on Israel;
verse_text: Isaiah 9.8 The Lord hath sent a worde into Iaakob, and it hath lighted vpon Israel.

text: Isaiah 9.8 The Lord has sent a word against Jacob, and it will fall on Israel;

text: For he says: "By the strength of my hand I have done it, and by my wisdom, for I have understanding; I remove the boundaries of peoples, and plunder their treasures; like a bull I bring down those who sit on thrones.
verse_text: Isaiah 10.13 For he hath said: By the strength of my own hand I have done it, and by my own wisdom I have understood: and I have removed the bounds of the people, and have taken the spoils of the princes, and as a mighty man hath pulled down them that sat on high.

text: Isaiah 10.13 For he says: "By the strength of my hand I have done it, and by my wisdom, for I have understanding; I remove the boundaries of peoples, and plunder their treasures; like a bull I bring down those who sit on thrones.
verse_text: Isaiah 10.13 Dixit enim: In fortitudine manus meæ feci, et in sapientia mea intellexi; et abstuli terminos populorum, et principes eorum deprædatus sum, et detraxi quasi potens in sublimi residentes.

text: Isaiah 10.13 For he says: "By the strength of my hand I have done it, and by my wisdom, for I have understanding; I remove the boundaries of peoples, and plunder their treasures; like a bull I bring down those who sit on thrones.
verse_text: Isaiah 10.13 Because he said, By ye power of mine owne hand haue I done it, and by my wisdome, because I am wise: therefore I haue remooued the borders of the people, and haue spoyled their treasures, and haue pulled downe the inhabitants like a valiant man.

text: Isaiah 10.13 For he says: "By the strength of my hand I have done it, and by my wisdom, for I have understanding; I remove the boundaries of peoples, and plunder their treasures; like a bull I bring down those who sit on thrones.
verse_text: Isaiah 10.13 For hee saith, By the strength of my hand I haue done it, and by my wisedome, for I am prudent: and I haue remooued the bounds of the people, and haue robbed their treasures, and I haue put downe the inhabitants like a valiant man.

text: My hand has found like a nest the wealth of the peoples; and as one gathers eggs that have been forsaken, so I have gathered all the earth; and there was none that moved a wing or opened the mouth or chirped."
verse_text: Isaiah 10.14 And my hand hath found the strength of the people as a nest; and as eggs are gathered, that are left, so have I gathered all the earth: and there was none that moved the wing, or opened the mouth, or made the least noise.

text: Isaiah 10.14 My hand has found like a nest the wealth of the peoples; and as one gathers eggs that have been forsaken, so I have gathered all the earth; and there was none that moved a wing or opened the mouth or chirped."
verse_text: Isaiah 10.14 Et invenit quasi nidum manus mea fortitudinem populorum; et sicut colliguntur ova quæ derelicta sunt, sic universam terram ego congregavi; et non fuit qui moveret pennam, et aperiret os, et ganniret.

text: Isaiah 10.14 My hand has found like a nest the wealth of the peoples; and as one gathers eggs that have been forsaken, so I have gathered all the earth; and there was none that moved a wing or opened the mouth or chirped."
verse_text: Isaiah 10.14 And mine hand hath found as a nest the riches of the people, and as one gathereth egges that are left, so haue I gathered all the earth: and there was none to mooue the wing or to open the mouth, or to whisper.

text: Isaiah 10.14 My hand has found like a nest the wealth of the peoples; and as one gathers eggs that have been forsaken, so I have gathered all the earth; and there was none that moved a wing or opened the mouth or chirped."
verse_text: Isaiah 10.14 And my hand hath found as a nest the riches of the people: and as one gathereth egges that are left, haue I gathered all the earth, and there was none that moued the wing, or opened the mouth, or peeped.

text: The glory of his forest and of his fruitful land the LORD will destroy, both soul and body, and it will be as when a sick man wastes away.
verse_text: Isaiah 10.18 Et gloria saltus ejus, et carmeli ejus, ab anima usque ad carnem consumetur; et erit terrore profugus.

text: Isaiah 10.18 The glory of his forest and of his fruitful land the LORD will destroy, both soul and body, and it will be as when a sick man wastes away.
verse_text: Isaiah 10.18 And shall consume the glory of his forrest, and of his fruitfull field both soule and body: and they shall bee as when a standerd bearer fainteth.

text: On a bare hill raise a signal; cry aloud to them; wave the hand for them to enter the gates of the nobles.

verse_text: Isaiah 13.2 Lift vp a standard vpon the hie mountaine: lift vp the voyce vnto them: wagge the hand, that they may goe into the gates of the nobles.

verse_text: Isaiah 13.2 Lift yee vp a banner vpon the high mountaine, exalt the voice vnto them, shake the hand, that they may goe into the gates of the nobles.

text: I myself have commanded my consecrated ones, and have summoned my mighty men to execute my anger, my proudly exulting ones.

text: Isaiah 13.3 I myself have commanded my consecrated ones, and have summoned my mighty men to execute my anger, my proudly exulting ones.

text: Isaiah 13.3 I myself have commanded my consecrated ones, and have summoned my mighty men to execute my anger, my proudly exulting ones.

text: Isaiah 13.3 I myself have commanded my consecrated ones, and have summoned my mighty men to execute my anger, my proudly exulting ones.
verse_text: Isaiah 13.3 I haue commanded my sanctified ones: I haue also called my mightie ones for mine anger, euen them that reioyce in my highnesse.

text: Isaiah 21.1 The oracle concerning the wilderness of the sea. As whirlwinds in the Negeb sweep on, it comes from the wilderness, from a terrible land.

text: You made a reservoir between the two walls for the water of the old pool. But you did not look to him who did it, or see him who planned it long ago.
verse_text: Isaiah 22.11 And you made a ditch between the two walls for the water of the old pool: and you have not looked up to the maker thereof, nor regarded him even at a distance, that wrought it long ago.

text: Isaiah 22.11 You made a reservoir between the two walls for the water of the old pool. But you did not look to him who did it, or see him who planned it long ago.
verse_text: Isaiah 22.11 Et lacum fecistis inter duos muros ad aquam piscinæ veteris; et non suspexistis ad eum qui fecerat eam, et operatorem ejus de longe non vidistis.

text: Isaiah 22.11 You made a reservoir between the two walls for the water of the old pool. But you did not look to him who did it, or see him who planned it long ago.
verse_text: Isaiah 22.11 And haue also made a ditche betweene the two walles, for the waters of the olde poole, and haue not looked vnto the maker thereof, neither had respect vnto him that formed it of olde.

text: Isaiah 22.11 You made a reservoir between the two walls for the water of the old pool. But you did not look to him who did it, or see him who planned it long ago.

text: At the end of seventy years, the LORD will visit Tyre, and she will return to her wages and will prostitute herself with all the kingdoms of the world on the face of the earth.

text: And you will be brought low; from the earth you shall speak, and from the dust your speech will be bowed down; your voice shall come from the ground like the voice of a ghost, and from the dust your speech shall whisper.
verse_text: Isaiah 29.4 Thou shalt be brought down, thou shalt speak out of the earth, and thy speech shall be heard out of the ground: and thy voice shall be from the earth like that of the python, and out of the ground thy speech shall mutter.

text: Isaiah 29.4 And you will be brought low; from the earth you shall speak, and from the dust your speech will be bowed down; your voice shall come from the ground like the voice of a ghost, and from the dust your speech shall whisper.
verse_text: Isaiah 29.4 Humiliaberis, de terra loqueris, et de humo audietur eloquium tuum; et erit quasi pythonis de terra vox tua, et de humo eloquium tuum mussitabit.

text: Isaiah 29.4 And you will be brought low; from the earth you shall speak, and from the dust your speech will be bowed down; your voice shall come from the ground like the voice of a ghost, and from the dust your speech shall whisper.
verse_text: Isaiah 29.4 So shalt thou be humbled, and shalt speake out of the ground, and thy speach shalbe as out of the dust: thy voyce also shall be out of the ground like him that hath a spirite of diuination, and thy talking shall whisper out of the dust.

text: Isaiah 29.4 And you will be brought low; from the earth you shall speak, and from the dust your speech will be bowed down; your voice shall come from the ground like the voice of a ghost, and from the dust your speech shall whisper.
verse_text: Isaiah 29.4 And thou shalt bee brought downe, and shalt speake out of the ground, and thy speach shall be low out of the dust, and thy voyce shalbe as of one that hath a familiar spirit, out of the ground, and thy speach shall whisper out of the dust.

text: You turn things upside down! Shall the potter be regarded as the clay, that the thing made should sayof its maker, "He did not make me"; or the thing formed say of him who formed it, "He has no understanding"?
verse_text: Isaiah 29.16 This thought of yours is perverse: as if the clay should think against the potter, and the work should say to the maker thereof: Thou madest me not: or the thing framed should say to him that fashioned it: Thou understandest not.

text: Isaiah 29.16 You turn things upside down! Shall the potter be regarded as the clay, that the thing made should sayof its maker, "He did not make me"; or the thing formed say of him who formed it, "He has no understanding"?
verse_text: Isaiah 29.16 Perversa est hæc vestra cogitatio; quasi si lutum contra figulum cogitet, et dicat opus factori suo: Non fecisti me; et figmentum dicat fictori suo: Non intelligis.

text: Isaiah 29.16 You turn things upside down! Shall the potter be regarded as the clay, that the thing made should sayof its maker, "He did not make me"; or the thing formed say of him who formed it, "He has no understanding"?
verse_text: Isaiah 29.16 Your turning of deuises shall it not be esteemed as the potters clay? for shall the worke say of him that made it, Hee made me not? or the thing formed, say of him that facioned it, He had none vnderstanding?

text: Isaiah 29.16 You turn things upside down! Shall the potter be regarded as the clay, that the thing made should sayof its maker, "He did not make me"; or the thing formed say of him who formed it, "He has no understanding"?
verse_text: Isaiah 29.16 Surely your turning of things vpside downe shall be esteemed as the potters clay: for shall the worke say of him that made it, He made me not? or shall the thing framed, say of him that framed it, He had no vnderstanding?

text: They said to him, "Thus says Hezekiah, 'This day is a day of distress, of rebuke, and of disgrace; children have come to the point of birth, and there is no strength to bring them forth.
verse_text: Isaiah 37.3 And they said to him: Thus saith Ezechias: This day is a day of tribulation, and of rebuke, and of blasphemy: for the children are come to the birth, and there is not strength to bring forth.

text: Isaiah 37.3 They said to him, "Thus says Hezekiah, 'This day is a day of distress, of rebuke, and of disgrace; children have come to the point of birth, and there is no strength to bring them forth.
verse_text: Isaiah 37.3 et dixerunt ad eum: Hæc dicit Ezechias: Dies tribulationis, et correptionis, et blasphemiæ, dies hæc; quia venerunt filii usque ad partum, et virtus non est pariendi.

text: Isaiah 37.3 They said to him, "Thus says Hezekiah, 'This day is a day of distress, of rebuke, and of disgrace; children have come to the point of birth, and there is no strength to bring them forth.
verse_text: Isaiah 37.3 And they sayd vnto him, Thus saith Hezekiah, This day is a day of tribulation and of rebuke and blasphemie: for the children are come to the birth, and there is no strength to bring foorth.

text: Isaiah 37.3 They said to him, "Thus says Hezekiah, 'This day is a day of distress, of rebuke, and of disgrace; children have come to the point of birth, and there is no strength to bring them forth.
verse_text: Isaiah 37.3 And they sayd vnto him; Thus sayth Hezekiah, This day is a day of trouble, and of rebuke, and of blasphemie: for the children are come to the birth, and there is not strength to bring foorth.

text: "'Whom have you mocked and reviled? Against whom have you raised your voice and lifted your eyes to the heights? Against the Holy One of Israel!
verse_text: Isaiah 37.23 Whom hast thou reproached, and whom hast thou blasphemed, and against whom hast thou exalted thy voice, and lifted up thy eyes on high? Against the Holy One of Israel.

text: Isaiah 37.23 "'Whom have you mocked and reviled? Against whom have you raised your voice and lifted your eyes to the heights? Against the Holy One of Israel!
verse_text: Isaiah 37.23 Cui exprobrasti? et quem blasphemasti? et super quem exaltasti vocem, et levasti altitudinem oculorum tuorum? ad Sanctum Israël.

text: Isaiah 37.23 "'Whom have you mocked and reviled? Against whom have you raised your voice and lifted your eyes to the heights? Against the Holy One of Israel!
verse_text: Isaiah 37.23 Whome hast thou railed on and blasphemed? and against whome hast thou exalted thy voyce, and lifted vp thine eyes on hie? euen against the holy one of Israel.

text: Isaiah 37.23 "'Whom have you mocked and reviled? Against whom have you raised your voice and lifted your eyes to the heights? Against the Holy One of Israel!
verse_text: Isaiah 37.23 Whom hast thou reproched and blasphemed? and against whome hast thou exalted thy voice, and lifted vp thine eyes on high? euen against the Holy One of Israel.

text: and said, "Please, O LORD, remember how I have walked before you in faithfulness and with a whole heart, and have done what is good in your sight." And Hezekiah wept bitterly.

text: Isaiah 38.3 and said, "Please, O LORD, remember how I have walked before you in faithfulness and with a whole heart, and have done what is good in your sight." And Hezekiah wept bitterly.
